description: this regex implementation is backwards compatible with the standard re module but offer additional functionality the re module s behaviour with zero width match changed in python and this module follows that behaviour when compiled for python python is no longer supported the last release that supported python wa this module is targeted at cpython it expects that all codepoints are the same width so it won t behave properly with pypy outside u u f because pypy store string a utf the regex module release the gil during matching on instance of the built in immutable string class enabling other python thread to run concurrently it is also possible to force the regex module to release the gil during matching by calling the matching method with the keyword argument concurrent true the behaviour is undefined if the string change during matching so use it only when it is guaranteed that that won t happen this module support unicode full unicode case folding is supported there are kind of flag scoped and global scoped flag can apply to only part of a pattern and can be turned on or off global flag apply to the entire pattern and can only be turned on the scoped flag are ascii a fullcase f ignorecase i locale l multiline m dotall s unicode u verbose x word w the global flag are bestmatch b enhancematch e posix p reverse r version v version v if neither the ascii locale nor unicode flag is specified it will default to unicode if the regex pattern is a unicode string and ascii if it s a bytestring the enhancematch flag make fuzzy matching attempt to improve the fit of the next match that it find the bestmatch flag make fuzzy matching search for the best match instead of the next match in order to be compatible with the re module this module ha behaviour version behaviour old behaviour compatible with the re module please note that the re module s behaviour may change over time and i ll endeavour to match that behaviour in version indicated by the version flag zero width match are not handled correctly in the re module before python the behaviour in those earlier version is split won t split a string at a zero width match sub will advance by one character after a zero width match inline flag apply to the entire pattern and they can t be turned off only simple set are supported case insensitive match in unicode use simple case folding by default version behaviour new behaviour possibly different from the re module indicated by the version flag zero width match are handled correctly inline flag apply to the end of the group or pattern and they can be turned off nested set and set operation are supported case insensitive match in unicode use full case folding by default if no version is specified the regex module will default to regex default version the regex module support both simple and full case folding for case insensitive match in unicode use of full case folding can be turned on using the fullcase flag please note that this flag affect how the ignorecase flag work the fullcase flag itself doe not turn on case insensitive matching version behaviour the flag is off by default version behaviour the flag is on by default it s not possible to support both simple set a used in the re module and nested set at the same time because of a difference in the meaning of an unescaped in a set for example the pattern a z aeiou is treated in the version behaviour simple set compatible with the re module a set containing and the letter a to z literal set containing letter a e i o u literal but in the version behaviour nested set enhanced behaviour a set which is set containing the letter a to z but excluding set containing the letter a e i o u version behaviour only simple set are supported version behaviour nested set and set operation are supported all group have a group number starting from group with the same group name will have the same group number and group with a different group name will have a different group number the same name can be used by more than one group with later capture overwriting earlier capture all the capture of the group will be available from the capture method of the match object group number will be reused across different branch of a branch reset eg first second ha only group if group have different group name then they will of course have different group number eg p foo first p bar second ha group foo and group bar in the regex s p foo a z w p foo there are group s is group p foo a z is group also called foo w is group because of the branch reset p foo is group because it s called foo if you want to prevent w from being group you need to name it different name different group number the issue number relate to the python bug tracker except where listed otherwise p horiz space or p h match horizontal whitespace and p vert space or p v match vertical whitespace the test of a conditional pattern can be a lookaround this is not quite the same a putting a lookaround in the first branch of a pair of alternative in the first example the lookaround matched but the remainder of the first branch failed to match and so the second branch wa attempted whereas in the second example the lookaround matched and the first branch failed to match but the second branch wa not attempted the posix standard for regex is to return the leftmost longest match this can be turned on using the posix flag note that it will take longer to find match because when it find a match at a certain position it won t return that immediately but will keep looking to see if there s another longer match there if there s no group called define then will be ignored except that any group defined within it can be called and that the normal rule for numbering group still apply prune discard the backtracking info up to that point when used in an atomic group or a lookaround it won t affect the enclosing pattern skip is similar to prune except that it also set where in the text the next attempt to match will start when used in an atomic group or a lookaround it won t affect the enclosing pattern fail cause immediate backtracking f is a permitted abbreviation keep the part of the entire match after the position where k occurred the part before it is discarded it doe not affect what group return you can use subscripting to get the capture of a repeated group this is in addition to the existing g the locale flag is intended for legacy code and ha limited support you re still recommended to use unicode instead a partial match is one that match up to the end of string but that string ha been truncated and you want to know whether a complete match could be possible if the string had not been truncated partial match are supported by match search fullmatch and finditer with the partial keyword argument match object have a partial attribute which is true if it s a partial match for example if you wanted a user to enter a digit number and check it character by character a it wa being entered sometimes it s not clear how zero width match should be handled for example should match character directly after matching character capturesdict is a combination of groupdict and capture groupdict return a dict of the named group and the last capture of those group capture return a list of all the capture of a groupcapturesdict return a dict of the named group and list of all the capture of those group allcaptures return a list of all the capture of all the group allspans return a list of all the span of the all capture of all the group group name can be duplicated fullmatch behaves like match except that it must match all of the string subf and subfn are alternative to sub and subn respectively when passed a replacement string they treat it a a format string expandf is an alternative to expand when passed a replacement string it treat it a a format string a match object contains a reference to the string that wa searched via it string attribute the detach string method will detach that string making it available for garbage collection which might save valuable memory if that string is very large recursive and repeated pattern are supported r or try to match the entire regex recursively etc try to match the relevant group name try to match the named group the first two example show how the subpattern within the group is reused but is not itself a group in other word tarzan jane love is equivalent to tarzan jane love tarzan jane it s possible to backtrack into a recursed or repeated group you can t call a group if there is more than one group with that group name or group number ambiguous group reference the alternative form p name and p name are also supported in version behaviour the regex module us full case folding when performing case insensitive match in unicode in version behaviour it us simple case folding for backward compatibility with the re module regex usually attempt an exact match but sometimes an approximate or fuzzy match is needed for those case where the text being searched may contain error in the form of inserted deleted or substituted character a fuzzy regex specifies which type of error are permitted and optionally either the minimum and maximum or only the maximum permitted number of each type you cannot specify only a minimum the type of error are insertion indicated by i deletion indicated by d substitution indicated by s in addition e indicates any type of error the fuzziness of a regex item is specified between and after the item example foo match foo exactly foo i match foo permitting insertion foo d match foo permitting deletion foo s match foo permitting substitution foo i s match foo permitting insertion and substitution foo e match foo permitting errorsif a certain type of error is specified then any type not specified will not be permitted in the following example i ll omit the item and write only the fuzziness d permit at most deletion but no other type i s permit at most insertion and at most substitution but no deletion e permit at least and at most error i d e permit at most insertion at most deletion at most error in total but no substitutionsit s also possible to state the cost of each type of error and the maximum permitted total cost example i d s each insertion cost each deletion cost each substitution cost the total cost must not exceed i d s i d s at most insertion at most deletion at most substitution each insertion cost each deletion cost each substitution cost the total cost must not exceed you can also use instead of if you want an exclusive minimum or maximum you can add a test to perform on a character that s substituted or inserted example s a z at most substitution which must be in the character set a z s i d at most substitution at most insertion which must be digit by default fuzzy matching search for the first match that meet the given constraint the enhancematch flag will cause it to attempt to improve the fit i e reduce the number of error of the match that it ha found the bestmatch flag will make it search for the best match instead further example to note regex search dog e cat and dog return cat because that match dog with error an unlimited number of error is permitted regex search dog e cat and dog return dog with a leading space because that match dog with error which is within the limit regex search e dog e cat and dog return dog without a leading space because the fuzzy search match dog with error which is within the limit and the e then it attempt a better fit in the first two example there are perfect match later in the string but in neither case is it the first possible match the match object ha an attribute fuzzy count which give the total number of substitution insertion and deletion the match object also ha an attribute fuzzy change which give a tuple of the position of the substitution insertion and deletion what this mean is that if the matched part of the string had been it would ve been an exact match however there were insertion at position and and deletion at position and so the actual string wa there are occasion where you may want to include a list actually a set of option in a regex one way is to build the pattern like this but if the list is large parsing the resulting regex can take considerable time and care must also be taken that the string are properly escaped and properly ordered for example cat before cat the new alternative is to use a named list the order of the item is irrelevant they are treated a a set the named list are available a the named list attribute of the pattern object if there are any unused keyword argument valueerror will be raised unless you tell it otherwise m match at the start of a word m match at the end of a word compare with b which match at the start or end of a word normally the only line separator is n x a but if the word flag is turned on then the line separator are x d x a x a x b x c and x d plus x u and u when working with unicode this affect the regex dot which with the dotall flag turned off match any character except a line separator it also affect the line anchor and in multiline mode version behaviour onlyset operator have been added and a set can include nested set the operator in order of increasing precedence are for union x y mean x or y double tilde for symmetric difference x y mean x or y but not both for intersection x y mean x and y double dash for difference x y mean x but not y implicit union ie simple juxtaposition like in ab ha the highest precedence thus ab cd is the same a a b c d example ab set containing a and b a z set containing a z a z qw set containing a z but not q or w a z qw same a above p l qw set containing all letter except q and w p n set containing all number except p ascii p letter set containing all character which are ascii and letterregex escape ha an additional keyword parameter special only when true only special regex character such a are escaped regex escape ha an additional keyword parameter literal space when true space are not escaped a match object ha additional method which return information on all the successful match of a repeated group these method are matchobject capture group return a list of the string matched in a group or group compare with matchobject group group matchobject start group return a list of the start position compare with matchobject start group matchobject end group return a list of the end position compare with matchobject end group matchobject span group return a list of the span compare with matchobject span group if the following pattern subsequently fails then the subpattern a a whole will fail min max the subpattern is matched up to max time if the following pattern subsequently fails then all the repeated subpatterns will fail a a whole for example is equivalent to flag flag the flag will apply only to the subpattern flag can be turned on or off the definition of a word character ha been expanded for unicode it conforms to the unicode specification at http www unicode org report tr a lookbehind can match a variable length string regex split regex sub and regex subn support a flag argument regex sub and regex subn support po and endpos argument regex findall and regex finditer support an overlapped flag which permit overlapped match regex splititer ha been added it s a generator equivalent of regex split a match object accepts access to the group via subscripting and slicing group can be named with name a well a the existing p name group can be referenced within a pattern with g name this also allows there to be more than group named character are supported note that only those known by python s unicode database will be recognised p property value p property value p value p value many unicode property are supported including block and script p property value or p property value match a character whose property property ha value value the inverse of p property value is p property value or p property value if the short form p value is used the property are checked in the order general category script block binary property latin the latin script script latin basiclatin the basiclatin block block basiclatin alphabetic the alphabetic binary property alphabetic yes a short form starting with is indicates a script or binary property islatin the latin script script latin isalphabetic the alphabetic binary property alphabetic yes a short form starting with in indicates a block property inbasiclatin the basiclatin block block basiclatin alpha alpha posix character class are supported these are normally treated a an alternative form of p the exception are alnum digit punct and xdigit whose definition are different from those of unicode alnum is equivalent to p posix alnum digit is equivalent to p posix digit punct is equivalent to p posix punct xdigit is equivalent to p posix xdigit a search anchor ha been added it match at the position where each search started continued and can be used for contiguous match or in negative variable length lookbehinds to limit how far back the lookbehind go the search start at position and match ab the search continues at position and match cd the search continues at position and fails to match any letter the anchor stop the search start position from being advanced so there are no more result search can also work backwards note that the result of a reverse search is not necessarily the reverse of a forward search the grapheme matcher is supported it conforms to the unicode specification at http www unicode org report tr group number will be reused across the alternative but group with different name will have different group number note that there is only one group the word flag change the definition of a word boundary to that of a default unicode word boundary this applies to b and b the matching method and function support timeouts the timeout in second applies to the entire operation

description: gensim is a python library for topic modelling document indexing and similarity retrieval with large corpus target audience is the natural language processing nlp and information retrieval ir community all algorithm are memory independent w r t the corpus size can process input larger than ram streamed out of core intuitive interfaceseasy to plug in your own input corpus datastream simple streaming api easy to extend with other vector space algorithm simple transformation api efficient multicore implementation of popular algorithm such a online latent semantic analysis lsa lsi svd latent dirichlet allocation lda random projection rp hierarchical dirichlet process hdp or word vec deep learning distributed computing can run latent semantic analysis and latent dirichlet allocation on a cluster of computer extensive documentation and jupyter notebook tutorial if this feature list left you scratching your head you can first read more about the vector space model and unsupervised document analysis on wikipedia this software depends on numpy and scipy two python package for scientific computing you must have them installed prior to installing gensim it is also recommended you install a fast blas library before installing numpy this is optional but using an optimized blas such a mkl atlas or openblas is known to improve performance by a much a an order of magnitude on osx numpy pick up it veclib blas automatically so you don t need to do anything special install the latest version of gensim or if you have instead downloaded and unzipped the source tar gz package for alternative mode of installation see the documentation gensim is being continuously tested under all supported python version support for python wa dropped in gensim install gensim if you must use python many scientific algorithm can be expressed in term of large matrix operation see the blas note above gensim tap into these low level blas library by mean of it dependency on numpy so while gensim the top level code is pure python it actually executes highly optimized fortran c under the hood including multithreading if your blas is so configured memory wise gensim make heavy use of python s built in generator and iterators for streamed data processing memory efficiency wa one of gensim s design goal and is a central feature of gensim rather than something bolted on a an afterthought quickstarttutorialstutorial videosofficial documentation and walkthroughwhen citing gensim in academic paper and thesis please use this bibtex entry gensim is open source software released under the gnu lgplv license copyright c now radim rehurek

description: python wrapper for sentencepiece this api will offer the encoding decoding and training of sentencepiece for linux x i macos and window win x environment you can simply use pip command to install sentencepiece python module to build and install the python wrapper from source try the following command to build and install wheel package if you don t have write permission to the global site package directory or don t want to install into it please try see this google colab page to run sentencepiece interactively training is performed by passing parameter of spm train to sentencepiecetrainer train function sentencepiece trainer can receive any iterable object to feed training sentence you can also pas a file object instance with write method to emit the output model to any device these feature are useful to run sentencepiece on environment that have limited access to the local file system e g google colab

description: sacrebleu post provides hassle free computation of shareable comparable and reproducible bleu score inspired by rico sennrich s multi bleu detok perl it produce the official wmt score but work with plain text it also know all the standard test set and handle downloading processing and tokenization for you the official version is hosted at http github com mjpost sacrebleu comparing bleu score is harder than it should be every decoder ha it own implementation often borrowed from moses but maybe with subtle change moses itself ha a number of implementation a standalone script with little indication of how they differ note they mostly don t but multi bleu pl expects tokenized input different flag passed to each of these script can produce wide swing in the final score all of these may handle tokenization in different way on top of this downloading and managing test set is a moderate annoyance sacre bleu what a mess sacrebleu aim to solve these problem by wrapping the original reference implementation papineni et al together with other useful feature the default are set the way that bleu should be computed and furthermore the script output a short version string that allows others to know exactly what you did a an added bonus it automatically downloads and manages test set for you so that you can simply tell it to score against wmt without having to hunt down a path on your local file system it is all designed to take bleu a little more seriously after all even with all it problem bleu is the default and admit it well loved metric of our entire research community sacre bleu a of v the default output format is changed to json for le painful parsing experience this mean that software that parse the output of sacrebleu should be modified to either i parse the json using for example the jq utility or ii pas f text to sacrebleu to preserve the old textual output the latter change can also be made persistently by exporting sacrebleu format text in relevant shell configuration file here s an example of parsing the score key of the json output using jq install the official python module from pypi python only in order to install japanese tokenizer support through mecab python you need to run the following command instead to perform a full installation with dependency in order to install korean tokenizer support through pymecab ko you need to run the following command instead to perform a full installation with dependency you can get a list of available test set with sacrebleu list please see datasets md for an up to date list of supported datasets you can also list available test set for a given language pair with sacrebleu list l en fr downloading is triggered when you request a test set if the dataset is not available it is downloaded and unpacked e g you can use the following command to download the source pas it through your translation system in translate sh and then score it some test set also have the output of system that were submitted to the task for example the wmt system test set this provides a convenient way to score sacrebleu i output detok txt t wmt l en deif you want to keep the old behavior you can pas f text or export sacrebleu format text all example below assume old style text output for a compact representation that save space let s say that you just translated the en de test set of wmt with your fancy mt system and the detokenized translation are in a file called output detok txt you can obtain a short version of the signature with short sh if you only want the score to be printed you can use the score only b flag the precision of the score can be configured via the width w flag sacrebleu know about common test set a detailed in the list example above but you can also use it to score system output with arbitrary reference in this case do not forget to provide detokenized reference and hypothesis file let s first compute bleu chrf and ter with the default setting let s now enable chrf which is a revised version of chrf that take into account word n gram observe how the nw get changed into nw in the signature metric specific argument are detailed in the output of help a you may have noticed sacrebleu generates version string such a bleu nrefs case mixed eff no tok a smooth exp version for reproducibility reason it s strongly recommended to share these signature in your paper sacrebleu know about metadata for some test set and you can output it like this if multiple field are requested they are output a tab separated column a tsv to see the available field add echo asdf or some other garbage data if you are interested in the translationese effect you can evaluate bleu on a subset of sentence with a given original language identified based on the origlang tag in the raw sgm file e g to evaluate only against originally german sentence translated to english use and to evaluate against the complement in this case origlang en fr c ru de use please note that the evaluator will return a bleu score only on the requested subset but it expects that you pas through the entire translated test set default a tokenizer will produce poor result for japanese let s use the ja mecab tokenizer if you provide the language pair sacrebleu will use ja mecab automatically chrf applies minimum to none pre processing a it deal with character n gram translation error rate ter ha it own special tokenizer that you can configure through the command line the default provided are compatible with the upstream ter implementation tercom but you can nevertheless modify the behavior through the command line all three metric support the use of multiple reference during evaluation let s first pas all reference a positional argument alternatively le recommended we can concatenate reference using tab a delimiters a well don t forget to pas num ref nr in this case a of version sacrebleu support evaluation of an arbitrary number of system for a particular test set and language pair this ha the advantage of seeing all result in a nicely formatted table let s pas all system output file that match the shell glob newstest online to sacrebleu for evaluation you can also change the output format to latex when enabled with the confidence flag sacrebleu will print the actual system score the true mean estimated from bootstrap resampling and the confidence interval around the mean by default the number of bootstrap resamples is b in the signature and can be changed with confidence n note although provided a a functionality having access to confidence interval for just one system may not reveal much information about the underlying model it often make more sense to perform paired statistical test across multiple system note when resampling the seed of the numpy s random number generator rng is fixed to if you want to relax this and set your own seed you can export the environment variable sacrebleu seed to an integer alternatively you can export sacrebleu seed none to skip initializing the rng s seed and allow for non deterministic behavior ideally one would have access to many system in case such a investigating whether a newly added feature yield significantly different score than the baseline or evaluating submission for a particular shared task sacrebleu offer two different paired significance test that are widely used in mt research this is an efficient implementation of the paper statistical significance test for machine translation evaluation and is result compliant with the reference moses implementation the number of bootstrap resamples can be changed with the paired b n flag and it default is when launched paired bootstrap resampling will perform paired approximate randomization ar is another type of paired significance test that is claimed to be more accurate than paired bootstrap resampling when it come to type i error riezler and maxwell iii type i error indicate failure to reject the null hypothesis when it is true in other word ar should in theory be more robust to subtle change across system our implementation is verified to be result compliant with the multeval toolkit that also us paired ar test for pairwise comparison the number of approximate randomization trial is set to by default this can be changed with the paired ar n flag in the example below we select newstest lium nmt en de a the baseline and compare it to other wmt submission using paired bootstrap resampling according to the result the null hypothesis i e the two system being essentially the same could not be rejected at the significance level of for the following comparison let s now run the paired approximate randomization test for the same comparison according to the result the finding are compatible with the paired bootstrap resampling test however the p value for the baseline v online b comparison is much higher than the paired bootstrap resampling test note that the ar test doe not provide confidence interval around the true mean a it doe not perform bootstrap resampling for evaluation it may be useful to compute bleu chrf or ter from a python script the recommended way of doing this is to use the object oriented api by creating an instance of the metric bleu class for example let s now remove the first reference sentence for the first system sentence the dog bit the man by replacing it with either none or the empty string this allows using a variable number of reference segment per hypothesis observe how the signature change from nrefs to nrefs var you can also use the compatibility api that provides wrapper function around the object oriented api to compute sentence level and corpus level bleu chrf and ter it should be noted that this api can be removed in future release sacrebleu is licensed under the apache license this wa all rico sennrich s idea originally written by matt post new feature and ongoing support provided by martin popel martinpopel and ozan caglayan ozancaglayan if you use sacrebleu please cite the following bugfix feature bugfix standard usage wa returning and using each reference twice feature under the hood many thanks to brightxiaohan http github com brightxiaohan for the bulk of the code contribution in this release feature fix march february february february february february january january january november august may may may april march march january january november november november november november november version november version october

description: it often happens that you have text data in unicode but you need to represent it in ascii for example when integrating with legacy code that doesn t support unicode or for ease of entry of non roman name on a u keyboard or when constructing ascii machine identifier from human readable unicode string that should still be somewhat intelligible a popular example of this is when making an url slug from an article title unidecode is not a replacement for fully supporting unicode for string in your program there are a number of caveat that come with it use especially when it output is directly visible to user please read the rest of this readme before using unidecode in your project in most of example listed above you could represent unicode character a or ba a to mention two extreme case but that s nearly useless to someone who actually want to read what the text say what unidecode provides is a middle road the function unidecode take unicode data and try to represent it in ascii character i e the universally displayable character between x and x f where the compromise taken when mapping between two character set are chosen to be near what a human with a u keyboard would choose the quality of resulting ascii representation varies for language of western origin it should be between perfect and good on the other hand transliteration i e conveying in roman letter the pronunciation expressed by the text in some other writing system of language like chinese japanese or korean is a very complex issue and this library doe not even attempt to address it it draw the line at context free character by character mapping so a good rule of thumb is that the further the script you are transliterating is from latin alphabet the worse the transliteration will be generally unidecode produce better result than simply stripping accent from character which can be done in python with built in function it is based on hand tuned character mapping that for example also contain ascii approximation for symbol and non latin alphabet note that some people might find certain transliteration offending most common example include character that are used in multiple language a user expects a character to be transliterated in their language but unidecode us a transliteration for a different language it s best to not use unidecode for string that are directly visible to user of your application see also the frequently asked question section for more info on common problem this is a python port of text unidecode perl module by sean m burke sburke cpan org this library contains a function that take a string object possibly containing non ascii character and return a string that can be safely encoded to ascii you can also specify an error argument to unidecode that determines what unidecode doe with character that are not present in it transliteration table the default is ignore meaning that unidecode will ignore those character replace them with an empty string strict will raise a unidecodeerror the exception object will contain an index attribute that can be used to find the offending character replace will replace them with or another string specified in the replace str argument preserve will keep the original non ascii character in the string note that if preserve is used the string returned by unidecode will not be ascii encodable a utility is also included that allows you to transliterate text from the command line in several way reading from standard input from a command line argument or from a file the default encoding used by the utility depends on your system locale you can specify another encoding with the e argument see unidecode help for a full list of available option nothing except python itself unidecode support python or later you need a python build with wide unicode character also called ucs build in order for unidecode to work correctly with character outside of basic multilingual plane bmp common character outside bmp are bold italic script etc variant of the latin alphabet intended for mathematical notation surrogate pair encoding of narrow build is not supported in unidecode if your python build support wide unicode the following expression will return true see pep for detail regarding support for wide unicode character in python to install the latest version of unidecode from the python package index use these command to install unidecode from the source distribution and run unit test use latin letter a o and u with diaeresis are transliterated by unidecode a a o u not according to german rule ae oe ue this is intentional and will not be changed rationale is that these letter are used in language other than german for example finnish and turkish german text transliterated without the extra e is much more readable than other language transliterated using german rule a workaround is to do your own replacement of these character before passing the string to unidecode same a with latin letter with accent discussed in the answer above the unicode standard encodes letter not letter in a certain language or their meaning with japanese and chinese this is even more evident because the same letter can have very different transliteration depending on the language it is used in since unidecode doe not do language specific transliteration see next question it must decide on one for certain character that are used in both japanese and chinese the decision wa to use chinese transliteration if you intend to transliterate japanese chinese or korean text please consider using other library which do language specific transliteration such a unihandecode language specific transliteration is a complicated problem and beyond the scope of this library change related to this will not be accepted please consider using other library which do provide this capability such a unihandecode language detection is a completely separate problem and beyond the scope of this library the maintainer of unidecode belief that providing access to source code on redistribution is a fair and reasonable request when basing product on voluntary work of many contributor if the license is not suitable for you please consider using other library such a text unidecode the string you are passing to unidecode have been wrongly decoded somewhere in your program for example you might be decoding utf encoded string a latin with a misconfigured terminal locale and or a text editor this might not be immediately apparent inspect your string with repr and consult the unicode howto unidecode know nothing about escape sequence interpreting these sequence and replacing them with actual unicode character in string literal is the task of the python interpreter if you are asking this question you are very likely misunderstanding the purpose of this library consult the unicode howto and possibly the unicode escape encoding in the standard library this is an issue with the software that is running your website not unidecode occasionally new version of unidecode library are released which contain improvement to the transliteration table this mean that you cannot rely that unidecode output will not change across different version of unidecode library if you use unidecode to generate url for your website either generate the url slug once and store it in the database or lock your dependency of unidecode to one specific version some of the issue in this section are discussed in more detail in this blog post by default unidecode optimizes for the use case where most of the string passed to it are already ascii only and no transliteration is necessary this default might change in future version for performance critical application two additional function are exposed unidecode expect ascii is optimized for ascii only input approximately time faster than unidecode expect nonascii on character string more on longer string but slightly slower for non ascii input unidecode expect nonascii take approximately the same amount of time on ascii and non ascii input but is slightly faster for non ascii input than unidecode expect ascii apart from difference in run time both function produce identical result for most user of unidecode the difference in performance should be negligible you can get the latest development version of unidecode with there is also an official mirror of this repository on github at http github com avian unidecodeplease make sure to read the frequently asked question section above before contacting the maintainer bug report patch and suggestion for unidecode can be sent to tomaz solc tablix org alternatively you can also open a ticket or pull request at http github com avian unidecodeoriginal character program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful but without any warranty without even the implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose see the gnu general public usa the program and documentation in this dist are distributed in the hope that they will be useful but without any warranty without even the implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a both training and tokenization thanks to the rust implementation take le than second to tokenize a gb of text on a server s cpu easy to use but also extremely versatile designed for research and description: this framework provides an easy method to compute dense vector representation for sentence paragraph and image the model are based on transformer network like bert roberta xlm roberta etc and achieve state of the art performance in various task text is embedding in vector space such that similar text is close and can efficiently be found using cosine similarity we provide an increasing number of state of the art pretrained model for more than language fine tuned for various use case further this framework allows an easy fine tuning of custom embeddings model to achieve maximal performance on your specific task for the full documentation see www sbert net the following publication are integrated in this framework we recommend python or higher pytorch or higher and transformer v or higher the code doe not work with python install with pipinstall the sentence transformer with pip install with condayou can install the sentence transformer with conda install from sourcesalternatively you can also clone the latest version from the repository and install it directly from the source code pytorch with cudaif you want to use a gpu cuda you must install pytorch with the matching cuda version follow pytorch get started for further detail how to install pytorch see quickstart in our documenation this example show you how to use an already trained sentence transformer model to embed sentence for another task first download a pretrained model then provide some sentence to the model and that s it already we now have a list of numpy array with the embeddings we provide a large list of pretrained model for more than language some model are general purpose model while others produce embeddings for specific use case pre trained model can be loaded by just passing the model name sentencetransformer model name full list of pretrained modelsthis framework allows you to fine tune your own sentence embedding method so that you get task specific sentence embeddings you have various option to choose from in order to get perfect sentence embeddings for your specific task see training overview for an introduction how to train your own embedding model we provide various example how to train model on various datasets some highlight are our model are evaluated extensively on datasets including challening domain like tweet reddit email they achieve by far the best performance from all available sentence embedding method further we provide several smaller model that are optimized for speed full list of pretrained modelsyou can use this framework for and many more use case for all example see example application if you find this repository helpful feel free to cite our publication sentence bert sentence embeddings using siamese bert network if you use one of the multilingual model feel free to cite our publication making monolingual sentence embeddings multilingual using knowledge distillation please have a look at publication for our different publication that are integrated into sentencetransformers contact person nil reimers info nil reimers dehttps www ukp tu darmstadt de don t hesitate to send u an e mail or report an issue if something is broken and it shouldn t be or if you have further question this repository contains experimental software and is published for the sole purpose of giving additional background detail on the respective publication

description: the full documentation of ftfy is available at ftfy readthedocs org the documentation cover a lot more than this readme so here are some link into it here are some example found in the real world of what ftfy can do ftfy can fix mojibake encoding mix ups by detecting pattern of character that were clearly meant to be utf but were decoded a something else doe this sound impossible it s really not utf is a well designed encoding that make it obvious when it s being misused and a string of mojibake usually contains all the information we need to recover the original string ftfy can fix multiple layer of mojibake simultaneously it can fix mojibake that ha had curly quote applied on top of it which cannot be consistently decoded until the quote are uncurled ftfy can fix mojibake that would have included the character u a non breaking space but the u a wa turned into an ascii space and then combined with another following space ftfy can also decode html entity that appear outside of html even in case where the entity ha been incorrectly capitalized these fix are not applied in all case because ftfy ha a strongly held goal of avoiding false positive it should never change correctly decoded text to something else the following text could be encoded in window and decoded in utf and it would decode a marqu however the original text is already sensible so it is unchanged ftfy is a python package that can be installed using pip or use pip install ftfy on system where python and are both globally installed and pip refers to python ftfy is developed using poetry it setup py is vestigial and is not the recommended way to install it install poetry check out this repository and run poetry install to install ftfy for local development such a experimenting with the heuristic or running test i m robyn speer also known a elia robyn lake you can find me on github or twitter ftfy ha been used a a crucial data processing step in major nlp research it s important to give credit appropriately to everyone whose work you build on in research this includes software not just high status contribution such a mathematical model all i ask when you use ftfy for research is that you cite it ftfy ha a citable record on zenodo a citation of ftfy may look like this in bibtex format the citation is

description: the pyparsing module is an alternative approach to creating and executing simple grammar v the traditional lex yacc approach or the use of regular expression the pyparsing module provides a library of class that client code us to construct the grammar directly in python code since first writing this description of pyparsing in late this technique for developing parser ha become more widespread under the name parsing expression grammar peg see more information on peg here here is a program to parse hello world or any greeting of the form salutation addressee the program output the following the python representation of the grammar is quite readable owing to the self explanatory class name and the use of and operator definition the parsed result returned from parsestring is a collection of type parseresults which can be accessed a a nested list a dictionary or an object with named attribute the pyparsing module handle some of the problem that are typically vexing when writing text parser extra or missing whitespace the above program will also handle hello world hello world etc quoted stringsembedded commentsthe example directory includes a simple sql parser simple corba idl parser a config file parser a chemical formula parser and a four function algebraic notation parser among many others there are many example in the online docstrings of the class and method in pyparsing you can find them compiled into online doc additional documentation resource and project info are listed in the online github wiki an entire directory of example can be found here mit license see header of the pyparsing py file see change file

description: seqeval is a python framework for sequence labeling evaluation seqeval can evaluate the performance of chunking task such a named entity recognition part of speech tagging semantic role labeling and so on this is well tested by using the perl script conlleval which can be used for measuring the performance of a system that ha processed the conll shared task data seqeval support following scheme and following metric seqeval support the two evaluation mode you can specify the following mode to each metric the default mode is compatible with conlleval if you want to use the default mode you don t need to specify it in strict mode the input are evaluated according to the specified schema the behavior of the strict mode is different from the default one which is designed to simulate conlleval if you want to use the strict mode please specify mode strict and scheme argument at the same time a minimum case to explain difference between the default and strict mode to install seqeval simply run mit

description: fast implementation of the edit distance levenshtein distance this library simply implement levenshtein distance with c and cython the algorithm used in this library is proposed by heikki hyyr explaining and extending the bit parallel approximate string matching algorithm of myers thanks to joerick cibuildwheel there are binary wheel on linux mac o and window you can install via pip it s quite simple with ipython i tried several library pyxdameraulevenshteinpylevpython levenshteinon python above library only support string but sometimes other type of object such a list of string word i support any iterable only requires hashable object of it so if object s hash is same it s same you can provide hash method to your object instance enjoy it is released under the mit license copyright c hiroyuki tanakapermission is hereby granted free of charge to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation file the software to deal in the software without restriction including without limitation the right to use copy modify merge publish distribute sublicense and or sell copy of the software and to permit person to whom the software is furnished to do so subject to the following condition the above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copy or substantial portion of the software the software is provided a is without warranty of any kind express or implied including but not limited to the warranty of merchantability fitness for a particular purpose and noninfringement in no event shall the author or copyright holder be liable for any claim damage or other liability whether in an action of contract tort or otherwise arising from out of or in connection with the software or the use or other dealing in the software

description: an apache nlp research library built on pytorch for developing state of the art deep learning model on a wide variety of linguistic task notice the allennlp library is now in maintenance mode that mean we are no longer adding new feature or upgrading dependency we will still respond to question and address bug a they arise up until december th if you have any concern or are interested in maintaining allennlp going forward please open an issue on this repository allennlp ha been a big success but a the field is advancing quickly it s time to focus on new initiative we re working hard to make ai tango the best way to organize research codebases if you are an active user of allennlp here are some suggested alternative if you re interested in using allennlp for model development we recommend you check out the allennlp guide for a thorough introduction to the library followed by our more advanced guide on github discussion when you re ready to start your project we ve created a couple of template repository that you can use a a starting place in addition there are external tutorial and others on the ai allennlp blog allennlp support loading plugins dynamically a plugin is just a python package that provides custom registered class or additional allennlp subcommands there is ecosystem of open source plugins some of which are maintained by the allennlp team here at ai and some of which are maintained by the broader community allennlp will automatically find any official ai maintained plugins that you have installed but for allennlp to find personal or third party plugins you ve installed you also have to create either a local plugins file named allennlp plugins in the directory where you run the allennlp command or a global plugins file at allennlp plugins the file should list the plugin module that you want to be loaded one per line to test that your plugins can be found and imported by allennlp you can run the allennlp test install command each discovered plugin will be logged to the terminal for more information about plugins see the plugins api doc and for information on how to create a custom subcommand to distribute a a plugin see the subcommand api doc allennlp requires python or later and pytorch we support allennlp on mac and linux environment we presently do not support window but are open to contribution the simplest way to install allennlp is using conda you can choose a different python version to install optional package such a checklist useor simply install allennlp all directly the plugins mentioned above are similarly installable e g it s recommended that you install the pytorch ecosystem before installing allennlp by following the instruction on pytorch org after that just run pip install allennlp if you re using python or greater you should ensure that you don t have the pypi version of dataclasses installed after running the above command a this could cause issue on certain platform you can quickly check this by running pip freeze grep dataclasses if you see something like dataclasses in the output then just run pip uninstall y dataclasses if you need pointer on setting up an appropriate python environment or would like to install allennlp using a different method see below conda can be used set up a virtual environment with the version of python required for allennlp if you already have a python environment you want to use you can skip to the installing via pip section download and install conda create a conda environment with python or would work a well activate the conda environment you will need to activate the conda environment in each terminal in which you want to use allennlp installing the library and dependency is simple using pip to install the optional dependency such a checklist runor you can just install all optional dependency with pip install allennlp all looking for bleeding edge feature you can install nightly release directly from pypiallennlp installs a script when you install the python package so you can run allennlp command just by typing allennlp into a terminal for example you can now test your installation with allennlp test install you may also want to install allennlp model which contains the nlp construct to train and run our officially supported model many of which are hosted at http demo allennlp org docker provides a virtual machine with everything set up to run allennlp whether you will leverage a gpu or just run on a cpu docker provides more isolation and consistency and also make it easy to distribute your environment to a compute cluster allennlp provides official docker image with the library and all of it dependency installed once you have installed docker you should also install the nvidia container toolkit if you have gpus available then run the following command to get an environment that will run on gpu you can test the docker environment withif you don t have gpus available just omit the gpus all flag for various reason you may need to create your own allennlp docker image such a if you need a different version of pytorch to do so just run make docker image from the root of your local clone of allennlp by default this build an image with the tag allennlp allennlp but you can change this to anything you want by setting the docker image name flag when you call make for example make docker image docker image name my allennlp if you want to use a different version of python or pytorch set the flag docker python version and docker torch version to something like and cuda respectively these flag together determine the base image that is used you can see the list of valid combination in this github container registry github com allenai docker image pkgs container pytorch after building the image you should be able to see it listed by running docker image allennlp you can also install allennlp by cloning our git repository create a python or virtual environment and install allennlp in editable mode by running this will make allennlp available on your system but it will use the source from the local clone you made of the source repository you can test your installation with allennlp test install see http github com allenai allennlp model for instruction on installing allennlp model from source once you ve installed allennlp you can run the command line interface with the allennlp command whether you installed from pip or from source allennlp ha various subcommands such a train evaluate and predict to see the full usage information run allennlp help you can test your installation by running allennlp test install everyone is welcome to file issue with either feature request bug report or general question a a small team with our own internal goal we may ask for contribution if a prompt fix doesn t fit into our roadmap to keep thing tidy we will often close issue we think are answered but don t hesitate to follow up if further discussion is needed the allennlp team at ai allenai welcome contribution from the community if you re a first time contributor we recommend you start by reading our contributing md guide then have a look at our issue with the tag good first issue if you would like to contribute a larger feature we recommend first creating an issue with a proposed design for discussion this will prevent you from spending significant time on an implementation which ha a technical limitation someone could have pointed out early on small contribution can be made directly in a pull request pull request pr must have one approving review and no requested change before they are merged a allennlp is primarily driven by ai we reserve the right to reject or revert contribution that we don t think are good addition if you use allennlp in your research please cite allennlp a deep semantic natural language processing platform allennlp is an open source project backed by the allen institute for artificial intelligence ai ai is a non profit institute with the mission to contribute to humanity through high impact ai research and engineering to learn more about who specifically contributed to this codebase see our contributor page

description: support for the internationalized domain name in application idna protocol a specified in rfc this is the latest version of the protocol and is sometimes referred to a idna this library also provides support for unicode technical standard unicode idna compatibility processing this act a a suitable replacement for the encoding idna module that come with the python standard library but which only support the older superseded idna specification rfc basic function are simply executed this package is available for installation from pypi for typical usage the encode and decode function will take a domain name argument and perform a conversion to a label or u label respectively you may use the codec encoding and decoding method using the idna codec module conversion can be applied at a per label basis using the ulabel or alabel function if necessary a described in rfc the idna specification doe not normalize input from different potential way a user may input a domain name this functionality known a a mapping is considered by the specification to be a local user interface issue distinct from idna conversion functionality this library provides one such mapping that wa developed by the unicode consortium known a unicode idna compatibility processing it provides for both a regular mapping for typical application a well a a transitional mapping to help migrate from older idna application for example k nigsg chen is not a permissible label a latin capital letter k is not allowed nor are capital letter in general ut will convert this into lower case prior to applying the idna conversion transitional processing provides conversion to help transition from the older standard to the current standard for example in the original idna specification the latin small letter sharp s wa converted into two latin small letter s s whereas in the current idna specification this conversion is not performed implementors should use transitional processing with caution only in rare case where conversion from legacy label to current label must be performed i e idna implementation that pre date for typical application that just need to convert label transitional processing is unlikely to be beneficial and could produce unexpected incompatible result function call from the python built in encoding idna module are mapped to their idna equivalent using the idna compat module simply substitute the import clause in your code to refer to the new module name all error raised during the conversion following the specification should raise an exception derived from the idna idnaerror base class more specific exception that may be generated a idna idnabidierror when the error reflects an illegal combination of left to right and right to left character in a label idna invalidcodepoint when a specific codepoint is an illegal character in an idn label i e invalid and idna invalidcodepointcontext when the codepoint is illegal based on it positional context i e it is contexto or contextj but the contextual requirement are not satisfied the idna and ut functionality relies upon pre calculated lookup table for performance these table are derived from computing against eligibility criterion in the respective standard these table are computed using the command line script tool idna data this tool will fetch relevant codepoint data from the unicode repository and perform the required calculation to identify eligibility there are three main mode idna data make libdata generates idnadata py and ut data py the pre calculated lookup table using for idna and ut conversion implementors who wish to track this library against a different unicode version may use this tool to manually generate a different version of the idnadata py and ut data py file idna data make table generate a table of the idna disposition e g pvalid contextj contexto in the format found in appendix b of rfc and the pre computed table published by iana idna data u print debugging output on the various property associated with an individual unicode codepoint in this case u that are used to ass the idna and ut status of a codepoint this is helpful in debugging or analysis the tool accepts a number of argument described using idna data h most notably the version argument allows the specification of the version of unicode to use in computing the table data for example idna data version make libdata will generate library data against unicode package the latest tagged release version is published in the python package index version support this library support python and higher a this library serf a a low level toolkit for a variety of application many of which strive for broad compatibility with older python version there is no rush to remove older intepreter support removing support for older version should be well justified in that the maintenance burden ha become too high python python is supported by version x of this library while active development of the version x series ha ended notable issue being corrected may be backported to x use idna in your requirement file if you need this library for a python application testing the library ha a test suite based on each rule of the idna specification a well a test that are provided a part of the unicode technical standard unicode idna compatibility processing emoji it is an occasional request to support emoji domain in this library encoding of symbol like emoji is expressly prohibited by the technical standard idna and emoji domain are broadly phased out across the domain industry due to associated security risk for now application that wish need to support these non compliant label may wish to consider trying the encode decode operation in this library first and then falling back to using encoding idna see the github project for more discussion

description: fasttext is a library for efficient learning of word representation and sentence classification in this document we present how to use fasttext in python requirementsinstallationusage overviewword representation modeltext classification modelimportant preprocessing data encoding conventionsmore examplesapitrain unsupervised parameterstrain supervised parametersmodel objectfasttext build on modern mac o and linux distribution since it us c feature it requires a compiler with good c support you will need python version or numpy scipy and pybind to install the latest release you can do or to get the latest development version of fasttext you can install from our github repository in order to learn word vector a described here we can use fasttext train unsupervised function like this where data txt is a training file containing utf encoded text the returned model object represents your learned model and you can use it to retrieve information you can save your trained model object by calling the function save model and retrieve it later thanks to the function load model for more information about word representation usage of fasttext you can refer to our word representation tutorial in order to train a text classifier using the method described here we can use fasttext train supervised function like this where data train txt is a text file containing a training sentence per line along with the label by default we assume that label are word that are prefixed by the string label once the model is trained we can retrieve the list of word and label to evaluate our model by computing the precision at p and the recall on a test set we use the test function we can also predict label for a specific text by default predict return only one label the one with the highest probability you can also predict more than one label by specifying the parameter k if you want to predict more than one sentence you can pas an array of string of course you can also save and load a model to from a file a in the word representation usage for more information about text classification usage of fasttext you can refer to our text classification tutorial when you want to save a supervised model file fasttext can compress it in order to have a much smaller model file by sacrificing only a little bit performance model filename ftz will have a much smaller size than model filename bin for further reading on quantization you can refer to this paragraph from our blog post in general it is important to properly preprocess your data in particular our example script in the root folder do this fasttext assumes utf encoded text all text must be unicode for python and str for python the passed text will be encoded a utf by pybind before passed to the fasttext c library this mean it is important to use utf encoded text when building a model on unix like system you can convert text using iconv fasttext will tokenize split text into piece based on the following ascii character byte in particular it is not aware of utf whitespace we advice the user to convert utf whitespace word boundary into one of the following symbol a appropiate spacetabvertical tabcarriage returnformfeedthe null characterthe newline character is used to delimit line of text in particular the eos token is appended to a line of text if a newline character is encountered the only exception is if the number of token exceeds the max line size constant a defined in the dictionary header this mean if you have text that is not separate by newlines such a the fil dataset it will be broken into chunk with max line size of token and the eos token is not appended the length of a token is the number of utf character by considering the leading two bit of a byte to identify subsequent byte of a multi byte sequence knowing this is especially important when choosing the minimum and maximum length of subwords further the eos token a specified in the dictionary header is considered a character and will not be broken into subwords in order to have a better knowledge of fasttext model please consider the main readme and in particular the tutorial on our website you can find further python example in the doc folder a with any package you can get help on any python function using the help function for exampletrain supervised train unsupervised and load model function return an instance of fasttext class that we generaly name model object this object expose those training argument a property lr dim w epoch mincount mincountlabel minn maxn neg wordngrams loss bucket thread lrupdaterate t label verbose pretrainedvectors so model wordngrams will give you the max length of word ngram used for training this model in addition the object expose several function the property word label return the word and label from the dictionary the object override getitem and contains function in order to return the representation of a word and to check if a word is in the vocabulary facebook pagestack overflowgoogle groupgithub

description: this repository contains custom pipe and model related to using spacy for scientific document in particular there is a custom tokenizer that add tokenization rule on top of spacy s rule based tokenizer a po tagger and syntactic parser trained on biomedical data and an entity span detection model separately there are also ner model for more specific task just looking to test out the model on your data check out our demo installing scispacy requires two step installing the library and intalling the model to install the library run to install a model see our full selection of available model below run a command like the following note we strongly recommend that you use an isolated python environment such a virtualenv or conda to install scispacy take a look below in the setting up a virtual environment section if you need some help with this additionally scispacy us modern feature of python and a such is only available for python or greater conda can be used set up a virtual environment with the version of python required for scispacy if you already have a python or environment you want to use you can skip to the installing via pip section follow the installation instruction for conda create a conda environment called scispacy with python activate the conda environment you will need to activate the conda environment in each terminal in which you want to use scispacy now you can install scispacy and one of the model using the step above once you have completed the above step and downloaded one of the model below you can load a scispacy model a you would any other spacy model for example if you are upgrading scispacy you will need to download the model again to get the model version compatible with the version of scispacy that you have the link to the model that you download should contain the version number of scispacy that you have to install a model click on the link below to download the model and then runalternatively you can install directly from the url by right clicking on the link selecting copy link address and runningthe abbreviationdetector is a spacy component which implement the abbreviation detection algorithm in a simple algorithm for identifying abbreviation definition in biomedical text schwartz hearst you can access the list of abbreviation via the doc abbreviation attribute and for a given abbreviation you can access it s long form which is a spacy token span using span long form which will point to another span in the document the entitylinker is a spacy component which performs linking to a knowledge base the linker simply performs a string overlap based search char gram on named entity comparing them with the concept in a knowledge base using an approximate nearest neighbour search currently v there are supported linkers you may want to play around with some of the parameter below to adapt to your use case higher precision higher recall etc this class set the kb ents attribute on spacy span which consists of a list tuple str float corresponding to the kb concept id and the associated score for a list of max entity per mention number of entity you can look up more information for a given id using the kb attribute of this class this component implement automatic aquisition of hyponym from large text corpus using the spacy matcher component passing extended true to the hyponymdetector will use the extended set of hearst pattern which include higher recall but lower precision hyponymy relation e g x compared to y x similar to y etc this component produce a doc level attribute on the spacy doc doc hearst pattern which is a list containing tuples of extracted hyponym pair the tuples contain if you use scispacy in your research please cite scispacy fast and robust model for biomedical natural language processing additionally please indicate which version and model of scispacy you used so that your research can be reproduced scispacy is an open source project developed by the allen institute for artificial intelligence ai ai is a non profit institute with the mission to contribute to humanity through high impact ai research and engineering

description: a very simple framework for state of the art nlp developed by humboldt university of berlin and friend flair is a powerful nlp library flair allows you to apply our state of the art natural language processing nlp model to your text such a named entity recognition ner part of speech tagging po special support for biomedical data sense disambiguation and classification with support for a rapidly growing number of language a text embedding library flair ha simple interface that allow you to use and combine different word and document embeddings including our proposed flair embeddings bert embeddings and elmo embeddings a pytorch nlp framework our framework build directly on pytorch making it easy to train your own model and experiment with new approach using flair embeddings and class now at version flair ship with state of the art model for a range of nlp task for instance check out our latest ner model new most flair sequence tagging model named entity recognition part of speech tagging etc are now hosted on the huggingface model hub you can browse model check detailed information on how they were trained and even try each model out online the project is based on pytorch and python because method signature and type hint are beautiful if you do not have python install it first here is how for ubuntu then in your favorite virtual environment simply do let s run named entity recognition ner over an example sentence all you need to do is make a sentence load a pre trained model and use it to predict tag for the sentence done the sentence now ha entity annotation print the sentence to see what the tagger found this should print we provide a set of quick tutorial to get you started with the library the tutorial explain how the base nlp class work how you can load pre trained model to tag your text how you can embed your text with different word or document embeddings and how you can train your own language model sequence labeling model and text classification model let u know if anything is unclear there is also a dedicated landing page for our biomedical ner and datasets with installation instruction and tutorial there are and etc asound conf for jack server is not running or cannot be started or connect call to dev shm jack default jack failed err no such file or directory or attempt to connect to server failed these are caused by alsa trying to connect to jack and can be safely ignored i m not aware of any simple way to turn those message off at this time besides entirely disabling printing while starting the microphone http github com uberi speech recognition issue issuecomment installing flac for o x directly from the source code will not work since it doesn t correctly add the executables to the search path installing flac using homebrew ensures that the search path is correctly updated first ensure you have homebrew then run brew install flac to install the necessary file to hack on this library and speech recognition init py version tag are then created using git config gpg program gpg git config user signingkey db f c de c dcd ff a git tag s version go here m version version go here release are done by running make release sh version go here to build the python source package sign them and upload them to pypi to run all the test testing is also done automatically by travisci upon every linux x executables are built from the flac source code with manylinux to ensure that it s compatible with a wide variety of distribution the built flac executables should be bit for bit reproducible binary for all of it encoders specifically it is a copy of xact xact app content resource flac in xact zip please report bug and suggestion at the issue tracker how to cite this library apa style recognition flac mac these file are gplv licensed and redistributable a long a the term of the gpl are satisfied the flac binary are an aggregate of separate program so these gpl restriction do not description: this module can be used to replace keywords in sentence or extract keywords from sentence it is based on the flashtext algorithm documentation can be found at flashtext read the doc for detecting word boundary currently any character other than this w a za z is considered a word boundary it s a custom algorithm based on aho corasick algorithm and trie dictionary time taken by flashtext to find term in comparison to regex time taken by flashtext to replace term in comparison to regex link to code for benchmarking the find feature and replace feature the idea for this library came from the following stackoverflow question the original paper published on flashtext algorithm the article published on medium freecodecamp issue tracker http github com vi k i flashtext issuessource code http github com vi k i flashtext the project is licensed under the mit license
