description: the stanford nlp group s official python nlp library it contains support for running various accurate natural language processing tool on language and for accessing the java stanford corenlp software from python for detailed information please visit our official website a new collection of biomedical and clinical english model package are now available offering seamless experience for syntactic analysis and named entity recognition ner from biomedical literature text and clinical note for more information check out our biomedical model documentation page if you use this library in your research please kindly cite our acl stanza system demo paper if you use our biomedical and clinical model please also cite our stanza biomedical model description paper the pytorch implementation of the neural pipeline in this repository is due to peng qi qipeng yuhao zhang yuhaozhang and yuhui zhang yuhui zh with help from jason bolton j tim dozat tdozat and john bauer angledluffa maintenance of this repo is currently led by john bauer if you use the corenlp software through stanza please cite the corenlp software package and the respective module a described here citing stanford corenlp in paper the corenlp client is mostly written by arun chaganty and jason bolton spearheaded merging the two project together to ask question report issue or request feature please use the github issue tracker before creating a new issue please make sure to search for existing issue that may solve your problem or visit the frequently asked question faq page on our website we welcome community contribution to stanza in the form of bugfixes and enhancement if you want to contribute please first read our contribution guideline stanza support python or later we recommend that you install stanza via pip the python package manager to install simply run this should also help resolve all of the dependency of stanza for instance pytorch or above if you currently have a previous version of stanza installed use to install stanza via anaconda use the following conda command note that for now installing stanza via anaconda doe not work for python for python please use pip installation alternatively you can also install from source of this git repository which will give you more flexibility in developing on top of stanza for this option runto run your first stanza pipeline simply following these step in your python interactive interpreter if you encounter request exception connectionerror please try to use a proxy the last command will print out the word in the first sentence in the input string or document a it is represented in stanza a well a the index for the word that governs it in the universal dependency parse of that sentence it head along with the dependency relation between the word the output should look like see our getting started guide for more detail aside from the neural pipeline this package also includes an official wrapper for accessing the java stanford corenlp software with python code there are a few initial setup step we provide comprehensive example in our documentation that show how one can use corenlp through stanza and extract various annotation from it to get your started we also provide interactive jupyter notebook in the demo folder you can also open these notebook and run them interactively on google colab to view all available notebook follow these step we currently provide model for all of the universal dependency treebanks v a well a ner model for a few widely spoken language you can find instruction for downloading and using these model here to maximize speed performance it is essential to run the pipeline on batch of document running a for loop on one sentence at a time will be very slow the best approach at this time is to concatenate document together with each document separated by a blank line i e two line break n n the tokenizer will recognize blank line a sentence break we are actively working on improving multi document processing all neural module in this library can be trained with your own data the tokenizer the multi word token mwt expander the po morphological feature tagger the lemmatizer and the dependency parser require conll u formatted data while the ner model requires the bioes format currently we do not support model training via the pipeline interface therefore to train your own model you need to clone this git repository and run training from the source for detailed step by step guidance on how to train and evaluate your own model please visit our training documentation stanza is released under the apache license version see the license file for more detail

description: overview why haiku quickstart installation example user manual documentation citing haiku haiku is a tool for building neural network think sonnet for jax haiku is a simple neural network library for jax developed by some of the author of sonnet a neural network library for tensorflow documentation on haiku can be found at http dm haiku readthedocs io disambiguation if you are looking for haiku the operating system then please see http haiku o org jax is a numerical computing library that combine numpy automatic differentiation and first class gpu tpu support haiku is a simple neural network library for jax that enables user to use familiar object oriented programming model while allowing full access to jax s pure function transformation haiku provides two core tool a module abstraction hk module and a simple function transformation hk transform hk module are python object that hold reference to their own parameter other module and method that apply function on user input hk transform turn function that use these object oriented functionally impure module into pure function that can be used with jax jit jax grad jax pmap etc there are a number of neural network library for jax why should you choose haiku let s take a look at an example neural network loss function and training loop for more example see our example directory the mnist example is a good place to start the core of haiku is hk transform the transform function allows you to write neural network function that rely on parameter here the weight of the linear layer without requiring you to explicitly write the boilerplate for initialising those parameter transform doe this by transforming the function into a pair of function that are pure a required by jax init and apply the init function with signature params init rng where are the argument to the untransformed function allows you to collect the initial value of any parameter in the network haiku doe this by running your function keeping track of any parameter requested through hk get parameter called by e g hk linear and returning them to you the params object returned is a nested data structure of all the parameter in your network designed for you to inspect and manipulate concretely it is a mapping of module name to module parameter where a module parameter is a mapping of parameter name to parameter value for example the apply function with signature result apply params rng allows you to inject parameter value into your function whenever hk get parameter is called the value returned will come from the params you provide a input to apply note that since the actual computation performed by our loss function doesn t rely on random number passing in a random number generator is unnecessary so we could also pas in none for the rng argument note that if your computation doe use random number passing in none for rng will cause an error to be raised in our example above we ask haiku to do this for u automatically with since apply is a pure function we can pas it to jax grad or any of jax s other transforms the training loop in this example is very simple one detail to note is the use of jax tree util tree map to apply the sgd function across all matching entry in params and grad the result ha the same structure a the previous params and can again be used with apply haiku is written in pure python but depends on c code via jax because jax installation is different depending on your cuda version haiku doe not list jax a a dependency in requirement txt first follow these instruction to install jax with the relevant accelerator support then install haiku using pip alternatively you can install via pypi our example rely on additional library e g bsuite you can install the full set of additional requirement using pip in haiku all module are a subclass of hk module you can implement any method you like nothing is special cased but typically module implement init and call let s work through implementing a linear layer all module have a name when no name argument is passed to the module it name is inferred from the name of the python class for example mylinear becomes my linear module can have named parameter that are accessed using hk get parameter param name we use this api rather than just using object property so that we can convert your code into a pure function using hk transform when using module you need to define function and transform them into a pair of pure function using hk transform see our quickstart for more detail about the function returned from transform some model may require random sampling a part of the computation for example in variational autoencoders with the reparametrization trick a random sample from the standard normal distribution is needed for dropout we need a random mask to drop unit from the input the main hurdle in making this work with jax is in management of prng key in haiku we provide a simple api for maintaining a prng key sequence associated with module hk next rng key or next rng key for multiple key for a more complete look at working with stochastic model please see our vae example note hk next rng key is not functionally pure which mean you should avoid using it alongside jax transformation which are inside hk transform for more information and possible workarounds please consult the doc on haiku transforms and available wrapper for jax transforms inside haiku network some model may want to maintain some internal mutable state for example in batch normalization a moving average of value encountered during training is maintained in haiku we provide a simple api for maintaining mutable state that is associated with module hk set state and hk get state when using these function you need to transform your function using hk transform with state since the signature of the returned pair of function is different if you forget to use hk transform with state don t worry we will print a clear error pointing you to hk transform with state rather than silently dropping your state the pure function returned from hk transform or hk transform with state are fully compatible with jax pmap for more detail on spmd programming with jax pmap look here one common use of jax pmap with haiku is for data parallel training on many accelerator potentially across multiple host with haiku that might look like this for a more complete look at distributed haiku training take a look at our resnet on imagenet example to cite this repository in this bibtex entry the version number is intended to be from haiku init py and the year corresponds to the project s open source release

description: fugashi is a cython wrapper for mecab a japanese tokenizer and morphological analysis tool wheel are provided for linux osx and win and unidic is easy to install issue check out the interactive demo see the blog post for background on why fugashi exists and some of the design decision or see this guide for a basic introduction to japanese tokenization if you are on an unsupported platform like powerpc you ll need to install mecab first it s recommended you install from source fugashi requires a dictionary unidic is recommended and two easy to install version are provided if you just want to make sure thing work you can start with unidic lite but for more serious processing unidic is recommended for production use you ll generally want to generate your own dictionary too for detail see the mecab documentation to get either of these dictionary you can install them directly using pip or do the below for more information on the different mecab dictionary available see this article fugashi is written with the assumption you ll use unidic to process japanese but it support arbitrary dictionary if you re using a dictionary besides unidic you can use the generictagger like this you can also create a dictionary wrapper to get feature information a a named tuple if you use fugashi in research it would be appreciated if you cite this paper you can read it at the acl anthology or on arxiv if you have a problem with fugashi feel free to open an issue however there are some case where it might be better to use a different library fugashi is released under the term of the mit license please copy it far and wide fugashi is a wrapper for mecab and fugashi wheel include mecab binary mecab is copyrighted free software by taku kudo taku chasen org and nippon telegraph and telephone corporation and is redistributed under the bsd license

description: this framework provides an easy method to compute dense vector representation for sentence paragraph and image the model are based on transformer network like bert roberta xlm roberta etc and achieve state of the art performance in various task text is embedding in vector space such that similar text is close and can efficiently be found using cosine similarity we provide an increasing number of state of the art pretrained model for more than language fine tuned for various use case further this framework allows an easy fine tuning of custom embeddings model to achieve maximal performance on your specific task for the full documentation see www sbert net the following publication are integrated in this framework we recommend python or higher pytorch or higher and transformer v or higher the code doe not work with python install with pipinstall the sentence transformer with pip install with condayou can install the sentence transformer with conda install from sourcesalternatively you can also clone the latest version from the repository and install it directly from the source code pytorch with cudaif you want to use a gpu cuda you must install pytorch with the matching cuda version follow pytorch get started for further detail how to install pytorch see quickstart in our documenation this example show you how to use an already trained sentence transformer model to embed sentence for another task first download a pretrained model then provide some sentence to the model and that s it already we now have a list of numpy array with the embeddings we provide a large list of pretrained model for more than language some model are general purpose model while others produce embeddings for specific use case pre trained model can be loaded by just passing the model name sentencetransformer model name full list of pretrained modelsthis framework allows you to fine tune your own sentence embedding method so that you get task specific sentence embeddings you have various option to choose from in order to get perfect sentence embeddings for your specific task see training overview for an introduction how to train your own embedding model we provide various example how to train model on various datasets some highlight are our model are evaluated extensively on datasets including challening domain like tweet reddit email they achieve by far the best performance from all available sentence embedding method further we provide several smaller model that are optimized for speed full list of pretrained modelsyou can use this framework for and many more use case for all example see example application if you find this repository helpful feel free to cite our publication sentence bert sentence embeddings using siamese bert network if you use one of the multilingual model feel free to cite our publication making monolingual sentence embeddings multilingual using knowledge distillation please have a look at publication for our different publication that are integrated into sentencetransformers contact person nil reimers info nil reimers dehttps www ukp tu darmstadt de don t hesitate to send u an e mail or report an issue if something is broken and it shouldn t be or if you have further question this repository contains experimental software and is published for the sole purpose of giving additional background detail on the respective publication

description: this package provides wrapper for some pre processing perl script from the moses toolkit namely normalize punctuation perl tokenizer perl detokenizer perl and split sentence perl all provided class are importable from the package mosestokenizer all class have a constructor that take a two letter language code a argument en fr de etc and the resulting object are callable when created these wrapper object launch the corresponding perl script a a background process when the object are no longer needed you should call the close method to close the background process and free system resource the object also support the context manager interface thus if used within a with block the close method is invoked automatically when the block exit the following two usage of mosestokenizer are equivalent a shown above mosestokenizer callable object take a string and return a list of token string by contrast mosesdetokenizer take a list of token and return a string mosessentencesplitter doe more than the name say besides splitting sentence it will also unwrap text i e it will try to guess if a sentence continues in the next line or not it take a list of line string and return a list of sentence string mosespunctuationnormalizer object take a string a argument and return a string copyright lu s gomes luismsgomes gmail com this library is free software you can redistribute it and or modify it under the term of the gnu lesser general public license a published by the free software foundation either version of the license or at your option any later version this library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful but without any warranty without even the implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose see the gnu lesser general public license for more detail you should have received a copy of the gnu lesser general public license along with this library if not write to the free software foundation inc franklin street fifth floor boston ma usa

learning gehring et al classical structured prediction loss for sequence to sequence learning edunov et al hierarchical neural story generation fan et al wav vec unsupervised pre training for speech description: user generated content on the web and in social medium is often dirty preprocess your scraped data with clean text to create a normalized text representation for instance turn this corrupted input into this clean output clean text us ftfy unidecode and numerous hand crafted rule i e regex to install the gpl licensed package unidecode alongside you may want to abstain from gpl nb this package is named clean text and not cleantext if unidecode is not available clean text will resort to python s unicodedata normalize for transliteration transliteration to closest ascii symbol involes manually mapping i e to e unidecode s mapping is superiour but unicodedata s are sufficent however you may want to disable this feature altogether depending on your data and use case to make it clear there are inconsistency between processing text with or without unidecode carefully choose the argument that fit your task the default parameter are listed above you may also only use specific function for cleaning for this take a look at the source code so far only english and german are fully supported it should work for the majority of western language if you need some special handling for your language feel free to contribute there is also scikit learn compatible api to use in your pipeline all of the parameter above work here a well use poetry if you have a question found a bug or want to propose a new feature have a look at the issue page pull request are especially welcomed when they fix bug or improve the code quality if you don t like the output of clean text consider adding a test with your specific input and desired output built upon the work by burton dewilde for textacy apache

description: this repository contains the source code of ks a representative korean sentence segmentation toolkit i also conduct ongoing research about korean sentence segmentation algorithm and report the result to this repository if you have a good idea about korean sentence segmentation please feel free to talk through the issue ks can be easily installed using the pip package manager you can also install ks from source code this can be useful for adding word to user dictionary described in here ks is the sentence segmentation toolkit based on morpheme aware heuristic algorithm and split sentence is a key function of this toolkit you can segment input text to the sentence using this function click the triangle button for more detailed information and example code snippet of each paramter this parameter indicates input text you can also input list or tuple for batch processing not only string an example of single text segmentationan example of multiple text batch segmentationkss is an open ended sentence segmentation toolkit that can segment everywhere in the input text even if there are no punctuation mark but if you want to conduct punctuation only segmentation the setting to segment depending only on punctuation you can modify segmentation setting using this parameter this parameter indicates whether to use the heuristic algorithm for the open ended sentence segmentation if you set it true ks conduct open ended segmentation if you set it false ks conduct punctuation only segmentation i recommend to you set it false if input text follow the punctuation rule relatively well because ks can make mistake sometimes in the part without punctuation mark a shown in the performance analysis if this option is set to false the segmentation error rate will be downed however it doe mean ks will be le sensitive if your input text have relatively few punctuation mark such a message or blog article ks can t split most of the sentence therefore it must be adjusted according to the type of the input text an example of use heuristickss ha the feature that prevents to segment the part enclosed in bracket and quotation mark this parameter indicates whether to segment the part enclosed in bracket or quotation mark if you set it true ks doe not segment these part if you set it false ks segment the even in the part that are enclosed in bracket and quotation mark default is false i set it to false because it s too slow set to true if you need this feature an example of use quote bracket processingkss or later can segment sentence even if the pair of bracket and quotation mark do not match this wa a chronic problem in previous ks c but it wa fixed in by calibration feature about quotation mark and bracket mismatch however this feature us the recursive algorithm that ha poor time complexity of o n so it can be very slow in some case therefore ks provides the parameter to adjust the recursive algorithm p s from ks memoization with lru cache wa introduced this can improve performance by saving duplicated segmentation result an example of max recover stepan example of max recover lengthkss or later support morpheme analysis this parameter indicates which morpheme analyzer will be used during segmentation if you set it pynori or mecab sentence segmentation is possible even at the unspecified eomi in this case ks can segment sentence that use honorific dialect neologism and eomi transferred from noun and can grasped well the part that are difficult to grasp without morpheme information the following are summary of the three possible option ks use the pynori the pure python morpheme analyzer by default however you can change it to mecab ko the super fast morpheme analyzer based on c the performance of two analyzer is almost similar because they were developed based on the same dictionary mecab ko dic however since there is a lot of difference in speed we strongly recommend using mecab backend if you can install mecab ko in your environment from ks mecab backend us python mecab kor instead of python mecab ko and auto backend added this backend will select best backend according to your environmentan example of backendhow to install mecab ks or later support multiprocessing therefore multiple sentence can be segmented at the same time this parameter indicates the number of worker to use for multiprocessing if you set this value a or multiprocessing is disabled if you input ks us the maximum worker a many a possible if a different value is entered the number you entered of worker is allocated a shown in the performance evaluation multiprocessing can lead a very large effect on speed multiprocessing make segmentation much faster especially when using the pynori backend from ks auto is added this can select the best number of worker for your inference an example of num workersthis parameter indicates whether to enable the garbage collection during the sentence segmentation the pynori analyzer is implemented based on the data structure called trie however since this us recursive algorithm it often waste a lot of memory which lead to frequent garbage collection if you set it to true segmentation speed can be improved by disabling garbage collection of course when the segmentation process end garbage collection will be reactivated an example of disable gcsplit chunk is used when you want to segment input text into paragraph rather than sentence this function conduct the following two process note that this function segment input text into paragraph based only on the length not the content and it also support to chunk window level through the overlap option click the triangle button for more detailed information and example code snippet of each paramter this parameter indicates input text you can also input list or tuple for batch processing not only string this parameter indicates the maximum length of each chunk the split chunk function creates chunk by concatenating sentence while traversing the list of segmented sentence if the concatenated string is longer than the maximum length ks make it into a chunk paragraph including previous sentence this parameter indicates whether the sentence can be duplicated across the chunk if you set it to true sentence can be duplicated across the chunk like sliding window if you set it to false each sentence is going to unique split chunk is based on split sentence therefore all argument of split sentence can be used check the following example ks is available in various programming language if you find this toolkit useful please consider citing

description: python library for interactive topic model visualization this is a port of the fabulous r package by carson sievert and kenny shirley pyldavis is designed to help user interpret the topic in a topic model that ha been fit to a corpus of text data the package extract information from a fitted lda topic model to inform an interactive web based visualization the visualization is intended to be used within an ipython notebook but can also be saved to a stand alone html file for easy sharing note lda stand for latent dirichlet allocation stable version using pip development version on githubclone the repository and run python setup pythe best way to learn how to use pyldavis is to see it in action check out this notebook for an overview refer to the documentation for detail for a concise explanation of the visualization see this vignette from the ldavis r package ben mabey walked through the visualization in this short talk using a hacker news corpus visualizing topic modelsnotebook and visualization used in the demoslide deckcarson sievert created a video demoing the r package the visualization is the same and so it applies equally to pyldavis visualizing exploring the twenty newsgroup datato read about the methodology behind pyldavis see the original paper which wa presented at the acl workshop on interactive language learning visualization and interface in baltimore on june

description: a python package designed for structured prediction including reproduction of many state of the art syntactic semantic parser with pretrained model for more than language andhighly parallelized implementation of several well known structured prediction algorithm supar can be installed via pip or installing from source is also permitted a a prerequisite the following requirement should be satisfied you can download the pretrained model and parse sentence with just a few line of code by default we use stanza internally to tokenize plain text for parsing you only need to specify the language code lang for tokenization the call to parser predict will return an instance of supar utils dataset containing the predicted result you can either access each sentence held in dataset or an individual field of all result probability can be returned along with the result if prob true supar also support parsing from tokenized sentence or from file for bilstm based semantic dependency parsing model lemma and po tag are needed to train a model from scratch it is preferred to use the command line option which is more flexible and customizable below is an example of training biaffine dependency parser alternatively supar provides some equivalent command entry point registered in setup py biaffine dep crf o dep crf con and biaffine sdp etc to accommodate large model distributed training is also supported you can consult the pytorch documentation and tutorial for more detail the evaluation process resembles prediction see example for more instruction on training and evaluation supar provides pretrained model for english chinese and other language the table below list the performance and parsing speed of pretrained model for different task all result are tested on the machine with intel r xeon r cpu e v ghz and nvidia geforce gtx ti gpu english and chinese dependency parsing model are trained on ptb and ctb respectively for each parser we provide pretrained model that take bilstm a encoder we also provide model trained by finetuning pretrained language model from huggingface transformer we use robert large for english and hfl chinese electra g large discriminator for chinese during evaluation punctuation is ignored in all metric for ptb the multilingual dependency parsing model named biaffine dep xlmr is trained on merged selected treebanks from universal dependency ud v dataset by finetuning xlm roberta large the following table list result of each treebank language are represented by iso language code we use ptb and ctb datasets to train english and chinese constituency parsing model below are the result the multilingual model crf con xlmr is trained on spmrl dataset by finetuning xlm roberta large we follow instruction of benepar to preprocess the data for simplicity we then directly merge train dev test treebanks of all language in spmrl into big one to train the model the result of each treebank are a follows english semantic dependency parsing model are trained on dm data introduced in semeval task while chinese model are trained on news domain data of corpus from semeval task our data preprocessing step follow second order sdp the crf model for dependency constituency parsing are our recent work published in acl and ijcai respectively if you are interested in them please cite the implementation of structured distribution and semirings are heavily borrowed from torchstruct with some tailoring

description: python module for computing edit distance and alignment between sequence i needed a way to compute edit distance between sequence in python i wasn t able to find any appropriate library that do this so i wrote my own there appear to be numerous edit distance library available for computing edit distance between two string but not between two sequence this is written entirely in python this implementation could likely be optimized to be faster within python and could probably be much faster if implemented in c the library api is modeled after difflib sequencematcher this is very similar to difflib except that this module computes edit distance levenshtein distance rather than the ratcliff and oberhelp method that python s difflib us difflib doe not yield minimal edit sequence but doe tend to yield match that look right to people if you find this library useful or have any suggestion please send me a message the easiest way to install is using pip alternatively you can clone this git repo and install using distutils to uninstall with pip to see example of usage view the difflib documentation additional api level documentation is available on readthedocsthis requires python since it us argparse for the command line interface the rest of the code should be ok with earlier version of pythonexample api usage in addition to the sequencematcher method distance and match method are provided which compute the edit distance and the number of match even if the alignment of the two sequence is identical to difflib get opcodes and get matching block may return slightly different sequence the opcodes returned by this library represent individual character operation and thus should never span two or more character it s also possible to compute the maximum number of match rather than the minimum number of edits this doesn t implement the junk matching feature in difflib for contribution it s best to github issue and pull request proper testing and documentation suggested code of conduct is expected to be reasonable especially a specified by the contributor covenant

description: wikipedia api is easy to use python wrapper for wikipedias api it support extracting text section link category translation etc from wikipedia documentation provides code snippet for the most common use case this package requires at least python to install because it s using intenum goal of wikipedia api is to provide simple and easy to use api for retrieving information from wikipedia bellow are example of common use case getting single page is straightforward you have to initialize wikipedia object and ask for page by it name it s parameter language ha be one of supported language for checking whether page exists you can use function exists class wikipediapage ha property summary which return description of wiki page wikipediapage ha two property with url of the page it is fullurl and canonicalurl to get full text of wikipedia page you should use property text which construct text of the page a concatanation of summary and section with their title and text to get all top level section of page you have to use property section it return list of wikipediapagesection so you have to use recursion to get all subsection if you want to get other translation of given page you should use property langlinks it is map where key is language code and value is wikipediapage if you want to get all link to other wiki page from given page you need to use property link it s map where key is page title and value is wikipediapage if you want to get all category under which page belongs you should use property category it s map where key is category title and value is wikipediapage to get all page from given category you should use property categorymembers it return all member of given category you have to implement recursion and deduplication by yourself if you have problem with retrieving data you can get url of undrerlying api call this will help you determine if the problem is in the library or somewhere else githubpypitravisreadthedocs sectionsadds support for quoted page titlesadds support for python by not using f stringsuses code style enforced by flake increased code coverageuses type annotation minimal requirement is now python request timeoutadd header accept encoding gzipadded support for property categoriesremoving wikipedialanglinkpage keep track of it own language so it s easier to jump between different translation of the same pagerename directory from wikipedia to wikipediaapi to avoid collisionshandle redirects properlyusage method page instead of article in wikipediaadded support for property linksadded support for property langlinksuse property instead of functionsadded support for property infosupport for extracting text with html markdownadded initial version of unit testsit s possible to extract summary and section of the pageadded support for property extract

description: natural language processing for many language uralicnlp can produce morphological analysis generate morphological form lemmatize word and give lexical information about word in uralic and other language the language we support include the following language finnish russian german english norwegian swedish arabic ingrian meadow eastern mari votic olonets karelian erzya moksha hill mari udmurt tundra nenets komi permyak north sami south sami and skolt sami the functionality originates mainly in fst tool and dictionary developed in the giellalt infrastructure and apertium currently uralicnlp us nightly build for most of the supported language see the catalog of supported languagessome of the supported language check out uralicgui a graphical user interface for uralicnlp check out uralicnlp official java versionthe library can be installed from pypi if you want to use the constraint grammar feature from uralicnlp cg import cg you will also need to install visl cg if you are using linux and you run into problem with installing hfst you can find some help on a blog post on installing hfston window hfst depends on bit microsoft visual c redistributable although i would recommend using window subsystem for linux arabic and english fsts require foma neural model check out the wiki to learn how to use neural model the api is under constant development and new language will be added to the nightly build system that s why uralicnlp provides a functionality for looking up the list of currently supported language the method return letter iso code for the language the dictionary key list the language that are supported by the lexical lookup whereas morph list the language that have morphological fsts and cg list the language that have a cg if you have a lot of data to process it might be a good idea to download the morphological model for use on your computer locally this can be done easily although it is possible to use the transducer over akusanat api by passing force local false on the command line from python code when model are installed generate analyze and lemmatize method will automatically use them instead of the server side api more information about the model use uralicapi model info language to see information about the fsts and cgs such a license and author if you know how to make this information more accurate please don t hesitate to open an issue on github to remove the model of a language runa word form can be lemmatized with uralicnlp this doe not do any disambiguation but rather return a list of all the possible lemma an example of lemmatizing the word in erzya myv by default a descriptive analyzer is used use uralicapi lemmatize myv descriptive false for a non descriptive analyzer if word boundary is set to true the lemmatizer will mark word boundary with a you can also use your own transducerapart from just getting the lemma it s also possible to perform a complete morphological analysis an example of analyzing the word voita in finnish fin the default analyzer is descriptive to use a normative analyzer instead use uralicapi analyze voita fin descriptive false you can also use your own transducerfrom a lemma and a morphological analysis it s possible to generate the desired word form an example of generating the singular partitive form for the finnish noun k si the result is k tt the default generator is a regular normative generator uralicapi generate k si n sg par fin dictionary form true us a normative dictionary generator and uralicapi generate k si n sg par fin descriptive true a descriptive generator you can also use your own transducerif you need to get a lower level access to the hfst transducer object you can use the following codethe same parameter can be used here a for generate and analyze to specify whether you want to use the normative or descriptive analyzer and so on the default are get transducer language cache true analyzer true descriptive true dictionary form true note this requires the model to be installed see above and visl cg the disambiguation process is simple the return object is a list of tuples the first item in each tuple is the word form used in the sentence the second item is a list of cg word object in the case of a full disambiguation these list have only one cg word object but some time the result of the disambiguation still ha some ambiguity each cg word object ha three variable lemma form and morphology the cg disambiguate take in remove symbol a an optional argument it default value is true which mean that it remove the symbol segment surrounded by from the fst output before feeding it to the cg disambiguator if the value is set to false the fst morphology is fed in to the cg unmodified the default fst analyzer is a descriptive one to use a normative analyzer set the descriptive parameter to false cg disambiguate token descriptive false it is possible to run one cg with tag produced by transducer of multiple language the code above will use the finnish fin cg rule to disambiguate the tag produced by finnish fin and olonets karelian olo transducer the language flag parameter can be used to append the language code at the end of each morphological reading to identify the transducer that produced the reading it is also possible to pipe multiple cg analyzer this will run the initial morphological analysis in the first cg disambiguate and pas the disambiguated result to the next cg analyzer the example above will create a cg analyzer for finnish and olonets karelian and pipe them into a cg pipe object the analyzer will first use finnish cg with a finnish fst to disambiguate the sentence and then olonets karelian cg to do a further disambiguation note that fst is only run in the first cg object of the pipe uralicnlp make it possible to obtain the lexicographic information from the giella dictionary the information can contain data such a translation example sentence semantic tag morphological information and so on you have to define the language code of the dictionary for example sm selects the skolt sami dictionary the word used to query however can appear in any language if the word is a lemma in skolt sami the result will appear in exact match if it s a word form for a skolt sami word the result will appear in lemmatized and if it s a word in some other language the result will appear in other language i e if you search for cat in the skolt sami dictionary you will get a result of a form other language skolt sami lexical item that translate to cat an example of querying the skolt sami dictionary with car it is possible to list all lemma in the dictionary you can also group the lemma by part of speechby default uralicnlp us a tinydb backend this is easy a it doe not require an external database server but it can be extremely slow for this reason uralicnlp provides a mongodb backend make sure you have both mongodb and pymongo installed first you will need to download the dictionary and import it to mongodb the following example show how to do it for komi zyrian after the initial setup you can use the dictionary query but you will need to specify the backend now you can query the dictionary fast uralicnlp come with tool for parsing and searching conll u formatted data please refer to the wiki for the ud parser documentation uralicnlp provides semantic model for finnish semfi and other uralic language semur for komi zyrian erzya moksha and skolt sami find out how to use semantic modelswhen your nlp need grow out of what uralicnlp can provide we have your back rootroo offer consulting related to a variety of nlp task we have a strong academic background in the state of the art ai solution for description: pyahocorasick is a fast and memory efficient library for exact or approximate multi pattern string search meaning that you can find multiple key string occurrence at once in some input text the string index can be built ahead of time and saved a a pickle to disk to re re sed later the library provides an ahocorasick python module that you can use a a plain dict like trie or convert a trie to an automaton for efficient aho corasick search pyahocorasick is implemented in c and tested on python and up it work on linux mao and window older version until were tested and worked on python too and later may work on python but it is no longer tested in python the license is bsd clause some utility such a test and the pure python automaton are dedicated to the public domain many thanks for this package wasn t sure where to leave a thank you note but this package is absolutely fantastic in our application where we have a library of k crispr guide that we have to count in a stream of million of dna sequencing read this package doe it faster than the previous c program we used for the purpose and help u stick to just python code in our pipeline miika astrazeneca functional genomics centre http github com wojciechmula pyahocorasick issue you can fetch pyahocorasick from github http github com wojciechmula pyahocorasick pypi http pypi python org pypi pyahocorasick conda forge http github com conda forge pyahocorasick feedstock the documentation is published at http pyahocorasick readthedocs io this module is written in c you need a c compiler installed to compile native cpython extension to install then create an automaton you can use the automaton class a a trie add some string key and their associated value to this trie here we associate a tuple of insertion index original string a a value to each key string we add to the trie then check if some string exists in the trie and play with the get dict like method now convert the trie to an aho corasick automaton to enable aho corasick search then search all occurrence of the key the needle in an input string our haystack here we print the result and just check that they are correct the automaton iter method return the result a two tuples of the end index where a trie key wa found in the input string and the associated value for this key here we had stored a value a tuple with the original string and it trie insertion order you can also create an eventually large automaton ahead of time and pickle it to re load later here we just pickle to a string you would typically pickle to a file instead faq and who is using pyahocorasick http github com wojciechmula pyahocorasick wiki faq who is using pyahocorasickthe full documentation including the api overview and reference is published on readthedocs overviewwith an aho corasick automaton you can efficiently search all occurrence of multiple string the needle in an input string the haystack making a single pas over the input string with pyahocorasick you can eventually build large automaton and pickle them to reuse them over and over a an indexed structure for fast multi pattern string matching one of the advantage of an aho corasick automaton is that the typical worst case and best case runtimes are about the same and depends primarily on the size of the input string and secondarily on the number of match returned while this may not be the fastest string search algorithm in all case it can search for multiple string at once and it runtime guarantee make it rather unique because pyahocorasick is based on a trie it store redundant key prefix only once using memory efficiently a drawback is that it need to be constructed and finalized ahead of time before you can search string in several application where you search for several pre defined needle in a variable haystack this is actually an advantage aho corasick automaton are commonly used for fast multi pattern matching in intrusion detection system such a snort anti virus and many other application that need fast matching against a pre defined set of string key internally an aho corasick automaton is typically based on a trie with extra data for failure link and an implementation of the aho corasick search procedure behind the scene the pyahocorasick python library implement these two data structure a trie and an aho corasick string matching automaton both are exposed through the automaton class in addition to trie like and aho corasick method and data structure pyahocorasick also implement dict like method the pyahocorasick automaton is a trie a dict like structure indexed by string key each associated with a value object you can use this to retrieve an associated value in a time proportional to a string key length pyahocorasick is available in two flavor a cpython c based extension compatible with python and a simpler pure python module compatible with python and this is only available in the source repository not on pypi under the py directory and ha a slightly different api the type of string accepted and returned by automaton method are either unicode or byte depending on a compile time setting preprocessor definition of ahocorasick unicode a set in setup py the automaton unicode attribute can tell you how the library wa built on python unicode is the default on python byte is the default and only value warningwhen the library is built with unicode support on python an automaton will store or byte per letter depending on your python installation when built for byte only one byte per letter is needed unicode is not supported on python for now to install for common operating system use pip pre built wheel should be available on pypi at some point in the future to build from source you need to have a c compiler installed and configured which should be standard on linux and easy to get on macosx on window and python you need the microsoft visual c compiler for python aka visual studio there have been report that pyahocorasick doe not build yet with mingw it may build with cygwin but this ha not been tested if you get this working with these platform please report in a ticket to build from source clone the git repository or download and extract the source archive install pip and it setuptools companion and then run in a virtualenv of course if compilation succeeds the module is ready to use support is available through the github issue tracker to report bug or ask question you can submit contribution through github pull request the initial author and maintainer is wojciech mu a philippe ombredanne the current co owner rewrote documentation setup ci server and did a whole lot of work to make this module better accessible to end user alphabetic list of author andrew grigorevbogdandavid woakesedward bettsfrankie robertsonfrederik petersengladtoseeinada naokijan fanpastafarianistphilippe ombredannerenat nasyrovsylvain zimmerxiaopeng xuthis library would not be possible without help of many people who contributed in various way they created pull request reported bug a github issue or via direct message proposed fix or spent their valuable time on testing thank you this library is licensed under very liberal bsd clause license some portion of the code are dedicated to the public domain such a the pure python automaton and test code full text of license is available in license file while pyahocorasick try to be the finest and fastest aho corasick library for python you may consider these other library py aho corasick by janwritten in pure python poor performance ahocorapy by abusixwritten in pure python better performance than py aho corasick using pypy ahocorapy s search performance is only slightly worse than pyahocorasick s performs additional suffix shortcutting more setup overhead le search overhead for suffix lookup includes visualization tool for resulting automaton using pygraphviz mit licensed test coverage tested on all major python version pypy noaho by jeff donnerwritten in c doe not return overlapping match doe not compile on window july no support for the pickle protocol acora by stefan behnelwritten in cython large automaton may take a long time to build july no support for a dict like protocol to associate a value to a string key ahocorasick by danny yoowritten in c seems unmaintained last update in gpl licensed

description: this package provides a set of python language binding for the enchant spellchecking library for more information visit the project website http pyenchant github io pyenchant enchant is used to check the spelling of word and suggest correction for word that are miss spelled it can use many popular spellchecking package to perform this task including ispell aspell and myspell it is quite flexible at handling multiple dictionary and multiple language more information is available on the enchant website http abiword github io enchant for window user install the pre built binary package using pip these package bundle a pre built copy of the underlying enchant library user on other platform will need to install enchant using their system package manager brew on macos once the software is installed python s on line help facility can get you started launch python and issue the following command the credit for enchant itself go to dom lachowicz find out more detail on the enchant website listed above full mark to dom for producing such a high quality library the glue to pull enchant into python via ctypes wa written by ryan kelly he needed a decent spellchecker for another project he wa working on and all the solution turned up by google were either extremely non portable e g opening a pipe to ispell or had completely disappeared from the web what happened to snakespell it wa also a great excuse to teach himself about swig ctypes and even a little bit of the python c api finally after ryan stepped down from the project dimitri merejkowsky became the new maintainer

description: pyonmttok is the python wrapper for opennmt tokenizer a fast and customizable text tokenization library with bpe and sentencepiece support installation requirement table of contentssee the documentation for a description of each tokenization option the python wrapper support bpe and sentencepiece subword learning through a common interface create the subword learner with the tokenization you want to apply e g feed some raw data start the learning process the returned tokenizer instance can be used to apply subword tokenization on new data the token api allows to tokenize text into pyonmttok token object this api can be useful to apply some logic at the token level but still retain enough information to write the tokenization on disk or detokenize the pyonmttok token class ha the following attribute the pyonmttok tokentype enumeration is used to identify token that were split by a subword tokenization the enumeration ha the following value the pyonmttok casing enumeration is used to identify the original casing of a token that wa lowercased by the case feature or case markup tokenization option the enumeration ha the following value the tokenizer instance provide method to serialize or deserialize token object

description: the unicodecsv is a drop in replacement for python s csv module which support unicode string without a hassle supported version are python and pypy python s csv module doesn t easily deal with unicode string leading to the dreaded ascii codec can t encode character in position exception you can work around it by encoding everything just before calling write or just after read but why not add support to the serializer note that unicodecsv expects a bytestream not unicode so there s no need to use codecs open or similar wrapper plain open rb will do version dropped support for python but added it back see c b c for the mistaken breaking change

description: stemming algorithmspystemmer provides access to efficient algorithm for calculating a stemmed form of a word this is a form with most of the common morphological ending removed hopefully representing a common linguistic base form this is most useful in building search engine and information retrieval software for example a search with stemming enabled should be able to find a document containing cycling given the query cycle pystemmer provides algorithm for several mainly european language by wrapping the libstemmer library from the snowball project in a python module it also provides access to the classic porter stemming algorithm for english although this ha been superseded by an improved algorithm the original algorithm may be of interest to information retrieval researcher wishing to reproduce result of earlier experiment

description: a python module for english lemmatization and inflection lemminflect us a dictionary approach to lemmatize english word and inflect them into form specified by a user supplied universal dependency or penn treebank tag the library work with out of vocabulary oov word by applying neural network technique to classify word form and choose the appropriate morphing rule the system act a a standalone module or a an extension to the spacy nlp system the dictionary and morphology rule are derived from the nih s specialist lexicon which contains an extensive set information on english word form a more simplistic inflection only system is available a pyinflect lemminflect wa created to address some of the shortcoming of that project and add feature such a for the latest documentation see readthedocs the accuracy of lemminflect and several other popular nlp utility wa tested using the automatically generated inflection database agid a a baseline the agid ha an extensive list of lemma and their corresponding inflection each inflection wa lemmatized by the test software and then compared to the original value in the corpus the test included different inflected word the only external requirement to run lemminflect is numpy which is used for the matrix math that drive the neural net these net are relatively small and don t require significant cpu power to run to install do pip install lemminflectthe project wa built and tested under python and ubuntu but should run on any linux window mac etc system it is untested under python but may function in that environment with minimal or no change the code base also includes library function and script to create the various data file and neural net this includes such thing a none of these are required for run time operation however if you want of modify the system see the documentation for more info to lemmatize a word use the method getlemma this take a word and a universal dependency tag and return the lemma a a list of possible spelling the dictionary system is used first and if no lemma is found the rule system is employed to inflect word use the method getinflection this take a lemma and a penn treebank tag and return a tuple of the specific inflection s associated with that tag similary to above the dictionary is used first and then inflection rule are applied if needed the library provides lower level function to access the dictionary and the oov rule directly for a detailed description see lemmatizer or inflection to use a an extension you need spacy version or later version and earlier do not support the extension method used here to setup the extension first import lemminflect this will create new lemma and inflect method for each spacy token the method operate similarly to the method described above with the exception that a string is returned containing the most common spelling rather than a tuple if you find a bug please report it on the github issue list however be aware that when in come to returning the correct inflection there are a number of different type of issue that can arise some of these are not readily fixable issue with inflected form include one common issue is that some form of the verb be are not completely specified by the treekbank tag for instance be vbd inflects to either wa or were and be vbp inflects to either am or are in order to disambiguate these form other word in the sentence need to be inspected at this time lemminflect doesn t include this functionality

description: c by damir cavar oren baldinger maanvitha gongalla anurag kumar murali kammilibrought to you by the nlp lab org there is a growing number of natural language processing nlp tool module pipeline there doe not seem to be any standard for the output format here we are focusing on a standard for the output format syntax some future version of json nlp might address the output semantics a well json nlp is a standard for the most important output nlp pipeline and component can generate the relevant documentation can be found in the json nlp github repo and on it website at the nlp lab the python json nlp module contains general mapping function for json nlp to conll u a validator for the generated output an nlp pipeline interface for flair spacy nltk polyglot xrenner etc and various utility function there is a java json nlp maven module a well and there are wrapper for numerous popular nlp pipeline and tool linked from the nlp lab org website for more detail see json nlp this module is a wrapper for output from different nlp pipeline and module into a standardized json nlp format to install this package run the following command you might have to use pip on some system json nlp is based on a schema built by nlp lab org to comprehensively and concisely represent linguistic annotation we provide a validator to help ensure that generated json validates against the schema to enable interoperability with other annotation format we support conversion between them note that conversion could be lossy if the relative depth of annotation are not the same currently we have a conll u to json nlp converter that cover most annotation to convert the other direction json nlp provides a simple pipeline interface that should be implemented for embedding into a microservice the provided keyword argument should be used to toggle on or off processing component within the method if you have deployed a pipeline a a microservice see below we provide a local endpoint for a remotely deployed pipeline via the remotepipeline class the next step is the json nlp a microservice class with a pre built implementation of flask we recommend creating a server py with the flaskmicroservice class which extends the flask app a corresponding wsgi file would contain to disable a pipeline component such a phrase structure parsing addthe full list of property available that can be disabled or enabled arethe microservice expose the following uris these uris are shortcut to disable the other component of the parse in all case tokenlist will be included in the json nlp output an example url is text is provided to the microservice with the text parameter via either get or post if you pas url a a parameter the microservice will scrape that url and process the text of the website other parameter specific to your pipeline implementation can be passed a well

description: tokenizer po tagger and dependency parser for classical chinese text working on universal dependency udkanbun load ha three option udkanbun load mecab true danku false by default the ud kanbun pipeline us mecab for tokenizer and po tagger then us udpipe for dependency parser with the option mecab false the pipeline us udpipe for all through the processing with the option danku true the pipeline try to segment sentence automatically udkanbun udkanbunentry to tree ha an option to tree boxdrawingwidth for old terminal whose box drawing character are fullwidth to tree kaeriten true japanese true is convenient for japanese user you can simply use udkanbun on the command line if you have already installed spacy or later you can use ud kanbun via spacy language pipeline tar ball is available for linux and is installed by default when you use pip make sure to get gcc g python pip python devel package and then use python command in cygwin instead of python try notebook for google colaboratory koichi yasuoka

description: the stanford nlp group s official python nlp library it contains package for running our latest fully neural pipeline from the conll shared task and for accessing the java stanford corenlp server for detailed information please visit our official website if you use our neural pipeline including the tokenizer the multi word token expansion model the lemmatizer the po morphological feature tagger or the dependency parser in your research please kindly cite our conll shared task system description paper the pytorch implementation of the neural pipeline in this repository is due to peng qi and yuhao zhang with help from tim dozat and jason bolton this release is not the same a stanford s conll shared task system the tokenizer lemmatizer morphological feature and multi word term system are a cleaned up version of the shared task code but in the competition we used a tensorflow version of the tagger and parser by tim dozat which ha been approximately reproduced in pytorch though with a few deviation from the original for this release if you use the corenlp server please cite the corenlp software package and the respective module a described here citing stanford corenlp in paper the corenlp client is mostly written by arun chaganty and jason bolton spearheaded merging the two project together please use the following channel for question and issue report stanfordnlp support python or later we strongly recommend that you install stanfordnlp from pypi if you already have pip installed simply runthis should also help resolve all of the dependency of stanfordnlp for instance pytorch or above alternatively you can also install from source of this git repository which will give you more flexibility in developing on top of stanfordnlp and training your own model for this option runto run your first stanfordnlp pipeline simply following these step in your python interactive interpreter the last command will print out the word in the first sentence in the input string or document a it is represented in stanfordnlp a well a the index for the word that governs it in the universal dependency parse of that sentence it head along with the dependency relation between the word the output should look like note if you are running into issue like oserror errno invalid argument it s very likely that you are affected by a known python issue and we would recommend python or later and python or later we also provide a multilingual demo script that demonstrates how one us stanfordnlp in other language than english for example chinese traditional see our getting started guide for more detail aside from the neural pipeline this project also includes an official wrapper for acessing the java stanford corenlp server with python code there are a few initial setup step we provide another demo script that show how one can use the corenlp client and extract various annotation from it we currently provide model for all of the treebanks in the conll shared task you can find instruction for downloading and using these model here to maximize speed performance it is essential to run the pipeline on batch of document running a for loop on one sentence at a time will be very slow the best approach at this time is to concatenate document together with each document separated by a blank line i e two line break n n the tokenizer will recognize blank line a sentence break we are actively working on improving multi document processing all neural module in this library including the tokenizer the multi word token mwt expander the po morphological feature tagger the lemmatizer and the dependency parser can be trained with your own conll u format data currently we do not support model training via the pipeline interface therefore to train your own model you need to clone this git repository and set up from source for detailed step by step guidance on how to train and evaluate your own model please visit our training documentation stanfordnlp is released under the apache license version see the license file for more detail

description: self referencing embedded string selfies a robust molecular string representation mario krenn florian haese akshatkumar nigam pascal friederich alan aspuru guzik machine learning science and technology extensive blog post january talk on youtube about selfies a community paper with author on selfies and the future of molecular string representation blog explaining selfies in japanese language major contributor of v n alston lo and seyone chithrananda main developer of v alston lo chemistry advisor robert pollicea main objective is to use selfies a direct input into machine learning model in particular in generative model for the generation of molecular graph which are syntactically and semantically valid use pip to install selfies to check if the correct version of selfies is installed use the following pip command to upgrade to the latest release of selfies if you are using an older version use the following pip command please see the changelog to review the change between version of selfies before upgrading please refer to the documentation which contains a thorough tutorial for getting started with selfies and detailed description of the function that selfies provides we summarize some key function below a key property of selfies is the possibility to create valid random molecule in a very simple way inspired by a tweet by rajarshi guha these simple line give crazy molecule but all are valid can be used a a start for more advanced filtering technique or for machine learning model in this example we first build an alphabet from a dataset of selfies string and then convert a selfies string into it padded encoding note that we use the nop no operation symbol to pad our selfies which is a special selfies symbol that is always ignored and skipped over by selfies decoder making it a useful padding character in this example we relax the semantic constraint of selfies to allow for hypervalences caution hypervalence rule are much le understood than octet rule some molecule containing hypervalences are important but generally it is not known which molecule are stable and reasonable you can get an attribution list that trace the connection between input and output token for example let s see which token in the selfies string c n c branch c p c c ring branch are responsible for the output smile token attr is a list of attributionmaps containing the output token it index and input token that led to it for example the p appearing in the output smile at that location is a result of both the branch token at position and the p token at index this work for both encoding and decoding for finer control of tracking the translation like tracking ring you can access attribution in the underlying molecular graph with get attribution selfies us pytest with tox a it testing framework all test can be found in the test directory to run the test suite for selfies install tox and run by default selfies is tested against a random subset of size dataset sample on various datasets see changelog we thank jacques boitreaud andrew brereton nessa carson supersciencegrl matthew carbone x carbone vladimir chupakhin chupvl nathan frey ncfrey theophile gaudin hellojocelynlu hyunmin kim hmkim minjie li vincent mallet alexander minidis docminus kohulan rajan kohulan kevin ryan leanandmean benjamin sanchez lengeling andrew white zhenpeng yao and adamo young for their suggestion and bug report and robert pollice for chemistry advice apache license

description: pyserini is a python toolkit for reproducible information retrieval research with sparse and dense representation retrieval using sparse representation is provided via integration with our group s anserini ir toolkit which is built on lucene retrieval using dense representation is provided via integration with facebook s faiss library pyserini is primarily designed to provide effective reproducible and easy to use first stage retrieval in a multi stage ranking architecture our toolkit is self contained a a standard python package and come with query relevance judgment pre built index and evaluation script for many commonly used ir test collectionsinstall via pypi pyserini requires python and java due to it dependency on anserini since dense retrieval depends on neural network pyserini requires a more complex set of dependency to use this feature a pip installation will automatically pull in the transformer library to satisfy the package requirement pyserini also depends on pytorch and faiss but since these package may require platform specific custom configuration they are not explicitly listed in the package requirement we leave the installation of these package to you refer to documentation in our repo for additional detail the lucenesearcher class provides the entry point for sparse retrieval using bag of word representation anserini support a number of pre built index for common collection that it ll automatically download for you and store in cache pyserini index here s how to use a pre built index for the m marco passage ranking task and issue a query interactively using bm ranking the result should be a follows the faisssearcher class provides the entry point for dense retrieval and it usage is quite similar to lucenesearcher the only additional thing we need to specify for dense retrieval is the query encoder the result should be a follows for complete documentation please refer to our repo

description: automatic evaluation metric described in the paper bertscore evaluating text generation with bert iclr we now support about model see this spreadsheet for their correlation with human evaluation currently the best model is microsoft deberta xlarge mnli please consider using it instead of the default roberta large in order to have the best correlation with human evaluation updated to version updated to version updated to version updated to version updated to version updated to version see if you want to replicate our experiment on the coco captioning dataset for people in china downloading pre trained weight can be very slow we provide copy of a few model on baidu pan huggingface s datasets library includes bertscore in their metric collection updated to version support custom baseline file the option rescale with baseline is changed to rescale with baseline so that it is consistent with other option updated to version being compatible with huggingface s transformer v and minor fix several improvement related to efficency updated to version compatible with transformer v now updated to version fixing the bug with empty string issue supporting electra model and smaller bert model a new google sheet for keeping the performance i e pearson correlation with human judgment of different model on wmt to english including the script for tuning the best number of layer of an english pre trained model on wmt to english data see the detail updated to version bug fixed fixing the bug in v when having multiple reference sentence supporting multiple reference sentence with our command line tool updated to version a new bertscorer object that cache the model to avoid re loading it multiple time please see our jupyter notebook example for the usage supporting multiple reference sentence for each example the score function now can take a list of list of string a the reference and return the score between the candidate sentence and it closest reference sentence please see release log for older update equal contributionbertscore leverage the pre trained contextual embeddings from bert and match word in candidate and reference sentence by cosine similarity it ha been shown to correlate with human judgment on sentence level and system level evaluation moreover bertscore computes precision recall and f measure which can be useful for evaluating different language generation task for an illustration bertscore recall can be computed a if you find this repo useful please cite install from pypi with pip byinstall latest unstable version from the master branch on github by install it from the source by and you may test your installation by on a high level we provide a python function bert score score and a python object bert score bertscorer the function provides all the supported feature while the scorer object cache the bert model to faciliate multiple evaluation check our demo to see how to use these two interface please refer to bert score score py for implementation detail running bertscore can be computationally intensive because it us bert p therefore a gpu is usually necessary if you don t have access to a gpu you can try our demo on google colabwe provide a command line interface cli of bertscore a well a a python module for the cli you can use it a follows we provide example input under example you will get the following output at the end roberta large l no idf version hug trans p r f where roberta large l no idf version hug trans is the hash code starting from version we support rescaling the score with baseline scoresyou will get roberta large l no idf version hug trans rescaled p r f this make the range of the score larger and more human readable please see this post for detail when having multiple reference sentence please usewhere the r argument support an arbitrary number of reference file each reference file should have the same number of line a your candidate hypothesis file the i th line in each reference file corresponds to the i th line in the candidate file we currently support the language in multilingual bert full list please specify the two letter abbreviation of the language for instance using lang zh for chinese text see more option by bert score h the figure will be saved to out png please see this google sheet for the supported model and their performance this repo wouldn t be possible without the awesome bert fairseq and transformer
